functional_summary: Inhibits beta-catenin-mediated transcriptional activation by competing with Tcf/Lef. Cby1 is required for recruitment of Arl13b to the primary cilium. Promotes Ahi1 localisation to the centriole and is probably important for assembly and function of transition zone components (25103236). Cby1 may associate with membranes to promote the recruitment of FAM92 proteins for their higher-order assembly and subsequent membrane remodelling to promote ciliogenesis (27528616). Because of its proximity to the membrane vesicle, it is possible that Cby proteins may be involved in targeting and/or attachmentof the vesicles to the centriole, controlling intraflagellar transport and protein sorting of the ciliary membrane (22911743).

description: coiled-coil and C2 domain containing 2A [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:29253]
functional_summary: It is essential for the assembly of subdistal appendages. Protein is required for cilia formation and predicted to be involved in calcium- dependent membrane targeting. (PMID 24947469). Interacts with CEP290 in the basal body (PMID 24947469; 18950740). CC2D2A associates with NINL to provide a docking point for incoming transport vesicles at the entrance of ciliary compartments (26485645). Required for vesicle fusion (29281629). Play a role in Ca2+ regulated signalling pathways (18513680)

functional_summary: Participates in microtubule stabilization that facilitates dynein arm attachment and ciliary motility (28790179). Contributes to axonemal stability. A potential role, is to modify the doublet microtubule to provide a high affinity binding site for the docking complex and needed for dynein attachment (25572396) Binds microtubules and stabilises them against cold depolymerization. It is also an outer dynein arm assembly factor (31858719, 22581229)
functional_category: Unknown

functional_summary: Required for primary cilia formation and promotes the localisation of protein BBS4 to both centriolar satellites. Promotes genome stability and maintaining a stable microtubule array
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; non-motile cilium assembly; cytoplasmic microtubule organization; centriolar satellite

functional_summary: CCDC181 is a structural component of the axonemal structure of sperm flagella as well as motile cilia. It might be a component of the apparatus necessary for the generation of ciliary motility. C-terminal region interacts with microtubules of the axoneme and Hook1, acting as a linker protein for phosphoprotein phosphatase 1 (PP1) to tack the phosphatase to the axonemal structure of cilia and flagella. Pronostic factor for prostate cancer.
functional_category: motile cilium; microtubule; 9+2 motile cilium; sperm flagellum; manchette; tubulin binding; microtubule binding

functional_summary: Reportes as second site modifier of the ciliopathy Bardet-Biedl syndrome. It is a positive regulator of mTOR complex 2 and interacts with SIN1 and Kinesine 1 to regulate cilia length in vivo (23727834, 29445114).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly

description: coiled-coil domain 39 molecular ruler complex subunit [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:25244]
functional_summary: CCDC39 regulates centriole/deuterosome amplification and multiciliogenesis. CCDC39/40 protein complex might define the binding site of radial spokes along peripheral microtubules and provide anchoring sites for inner dynein arms (29317443). It is essential for assembly of inner dynein arms and the dynein regulatory complex (21131972, 21131974)

description: coiled-coil domain 40 molecular ruler complex subunit [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:26090]
functional_summary: CCDC40 is required for assembly of motile cilia. It is responsible for CCDC39 axonemal recruitment. functional_summary: This gene encodes a protein that is required for proper cilia motility and regulation of dynein activity (24094744). Assembly and maintenance of the protein components of the nexin- dynein regulatory complex (N- DRC) and thus the regulation of cilia motion. Maintaince of the integrity of N-DRC required for regulation of dynein-driven microtubule sliding (23991085, 29167384).

functional_summary: Organisation of spindle pole and centriolar satellite. It is involved in cilium formation, satellite organization, BBS4 recruitment to the primary cilium and ciliary trafficking. Overexpression induces formation of microtubule bundles, disruption of centriolar satellite organization and inhibits ciliogenesis (28235840, 31582766). Interacts with ARMC9 and TOGORAM1 (32453716). When mutated in dogs causes late onset retinal degeneration (33273526)

functional_summary: Suppressor of ciliogenesis by acting simply as a passive physical barrier and by capping the growing ends of microtubules to prevent their elongation. Regulation the assembly of subdistal appendages (SDA) core components. Has a role in regulating centrosome duplication and separation (26965371). Regulates the length of centrioles and prevents aberrant formation of primary cilia, components to a CP110 scaffold may be needed to facilitate depolymerization (21620453). Studies suggest that CP110 might control discrete functions in the centrosome cycle and constitutes a set of controls that govern the switch from centriolar to basal body function (17719545).

functional_summary: Acts as a scaffold for the cilium disassembly complex, which includes Nde1, Aurora A, and OFD1, which is recruited to the ciliary base for timely cilium disassembly, plays a role in NPC proliferation, cilia formation, controlling the cilium axoneme and BB structure, regulates centriole duplication and elongation (30626697). Promotes the extension of the centriolar cylinder, presumably via its ability to recruit tubulin to the nascent structure, studies propose that functions as a scaffold for tubulin addition (19481458).
functional_category: Unknown

functional_summary: Has an important role in regulating microtubule length in cilia by facilitating tubulin addition to ciliary microtubules and might also be involved in regulating other factors, possibly by interacting with Nek1. Cep104 is involved in the stabilization of the ciliary axoneme or in cilia formation and elongation, mutations cause ciliopathies (28017521). Regulates ciliary assembly by interacting with centriolar proteins that suppress cilia formation, detaches from these proteins at the onset of cilia formation and moves to the tip of the nascent cilium (23970417).
functional_category: centriole; spindle; spindle pole

functional_summary: Is essential for the recruitment of C2CD3 and Talpid3 to the nascent centrioles, and is responsible for promoting the assembly of the centriole appendages that are needed for subsequent ciliogenesis. It is a daughter centriole- enriched protein that plays an essential role in centriole elongation (30988386). Plays a key role in the duplication and maturation of centrioles, which in principle could impact the production of a functional basal body (29847808).

functional_summary: It encodes a subdistal appendage protein that regulates TGF-/bone morphogenetic protein (BMP) signaling and RAB11 trafficking at the primary cilium. It has no major effect on centrosome structure but leads to increased ciliation frequency (29514088).

functional_summary: CEP135/Bld10 promotes the assembly and stability of the centriolar microtubule wall. Induces the formation of protofilament-based ring-like structures, binding directly to tubulin, protofilaments, and microtubules (27477386). Required for centriole conversion to centrosome (26595382). Plays an important role in the assembly of centriole/basal bodies and stabilisation of microtubules, maintaining basal body integrity (23810536, 23115304, 22898782). Knockdown of CEP135 leads to disorganised interphase and mitotic spindle microtubules (22521416)

functional_summary: Promotes and restricts transition zone (TZ) assembly before ciliogenesis. Interacts with core TZ components CEP290 and mediates their association with MTs. Loss of CEP162 arrests ciliogenesis at the stage of TZ assembly; gain of CEP162 at cilia tips promotes ectopic assembly of TZ components
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; ciliary plasm; axoneme; microtubule; plasma membrane bounded cell projection cytoplasm; cytoplasmic region; centriole; spindle; cytoplasmic microtubule; centriolar satellite; axonemal microtubule

functional_summary: Assembly of primary cilia and promotes vesicular docking and trafficking that initiates cilia membrane biogenesis (17954613, 23253480). CEP164 promotes accumulation of GTP-Rab8 at the centrosome, providing a molecular link connecting the M-centriole to components of the machinery that initiate ciliary membrane biogenesis (23253480). Recruitment of active tau tubulin kinase 2 (TTBK2) to centrioles, leading to removal of CP110 and recruitment of intraflagellar transport proteins (24982133). Mutations in CEP164 are related to nephronophthisis and Joubert syndrome, it may may facilitate the docking of the INPP5EDE6D complex to the centrosomal distal appendage/transition fiber (23150559). Mutations also reported in a BBS/PCD case (32367404).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; centriole

functional_summary: Required for anchoring the subdistal appendages (SDA) complex in the centrifuge to the cytoplasmic microtubule network. It is an FHDC1 buinding protein to keep this connection (29742020). Recruits microtubule-depolymerizing factor KIF2A to disassemble cilium (31197141).
functional_category: microtubule; centriole; spindle; centriolar subdistal appendage

functional_summary: Recruitment of ciliary vesicles to the centrioles during early ciliogenesis, which suggest it is a regulator for membrane trafficking pathways . CEP19 recruits and associates with RABL2 to the basal body, promoting cilia assembly via its interactions with the FT-B complex (28659385). CEP19-RABL2B complex plays a critical role as a regulator to initiate intraflagellar transport (28625565, 28428259).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; establishment of organelle localization; establishment of vesicle localization; vesicle localization; microtubule anchoring; vesicle targeting; microtubule anchoring at microtubule organizing center; microtubule anchoring at centrosome; Golgi vesicle transport; ciliary basal body; centriole; spindle; spindle pole

functional_summary: Regulation of integrity of the centriole distal end and membrane anchoring. Complex with OFD1 to initiate ciliogenesis and control cilia length (26643951). Involved in cilia formation and regulating the interaction of PCM1 satellites with microtubules and motors (20551181). Regulates the assembly and maintains the stability and dynamics of microtubules. It may inhibit tubulin assembly by sequestering soluble tubulin (28694353).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; microtubule anchoring; motile cilium; ciliary basal body; centriole; centriolar satellite

functional_summary: Interact with proteins implicated in rhodopsin trafficking (NEK2 and NINL). Rrecruitment of several proteins to centriole proximal ends, including Girdin (Girders of actin filaments) and proteins that associate with the distal region of the mother centriole (NEK2, ninein, CEP170, p150glued and KIF2A) (30421101). C-NAP1 anchores rootletin filaments that hold duplicated centrosomes together(28100636). Mutations are associated to Usher Syndrome and retinitis pigmentosa (28005958).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; non-motile cilium assembly; microtubule organizing center organization; centrosome cycle; sensory perception of light stimulus; positive regulation of protein localization; protein localization to microtubule cytoskeleton; protein localization to centrosome; protein localization to microtubule organizing center; visual perception; protein localization to cytoskeleton; detection of external stimulus; detection of abiotic stimulus; centriole-centriole cohesion; response to light stimulus; detection of light stimulus; response to radiation; regulation of protein localization to centrosome; detection of light stimulus involved in visual perception; detection of light stimulus involved in sensory perception; ciliary basal body; centriole; non-motile cilium; 9+0 non-motile cilium; photoreceptor cell cilium; photoreceptor outer segment; photoreceptor inner segment

functional_summary: Assembly and stabilisation of the primary cilium as well as centrosomal function (30478281, 22563985). Interacts with a centriolar satellite protein PCM-1 and is implicated in molecular pathways related to BBS4 function. CEP250 binds PCM- 1 and are involved in ciliary targeting of Rab8 required to promote ciliogenesis. Interacts with components of both dynein and kinesin motor machineries (18772192). Regulation of intracellular protein trafficking by association with microtubule-based transport protein RPGR (16632484). CEP250 plays an important role in the formation and stabilisation of the primary cilium as well as centrosomal function, stabilises the linkage of axoneme microtubules to the ciliary membrane to maintain the integrity of the ciliary diffusion barrier. CEP290 is critical for positioning the molecular components that are necessary for correct processing of Shh signalling in the primary cilium (30478281)

functional_summary: Also calles CAP350. Facilitates the localization of CEP19 to the centriole (28659385). CEP250 is necessary for recruitment of FOP and provides a docking site for it at the centrosome. Both CEP250 and FOP form a complex and are required for microtubules anchoring to the centrosome (16314388). CEP350-FOP complex promotes recruitment of both the CEP19-RABL2B complex and TTBK2 to the mother centriole (28625565). Centriole growth is regulated by CAP350, which is also required early during the procentriole assembly process when the first microtubule is polymerised (19052644)
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; non-motile cilium assembly; protein localization to microtubule cytoskeleton; protein localization to centrosome; protein localization to microtubule organizing center; protein localization to cytoskeleton; microtubule anchoring; centriole; spindle; tubulin binding; microtubule binding

functional_summary: Regulation of tubulin glutamyl posttranslational modifications by mediating ciliary transport of TTLL6 between the basal body and cilium, therefore, it is also required for localising TTLL6 to the cilium. CEP41 is also involved in ciliary structural formation and motility through glutamylation and its loss of CEP41 has been identified as a cause of Joubert syndrome (22246503). CEP41 regulates cilia disassembly and angiogenesis through AURKA activation by modulating axonemal tubulin glutamylation (31885126)
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; peptidyl-glutamic acid modification; ciliary basal body; centriole

functional_summary: Connection of the two centrosomes of a cell during interphase, required for cilia and mitotic spingle formation. Rootletin binds CEP68 modulating the thickness of rootletin filaments and promoting rootletin filament formation. Rootletin and CEP68 rings are the anchoring point of filaments that radiate into the cytoplasm (29463719). CEP68, C-NAP1 and Rootletin, cooperate in centrosome cohesion (18042621). Interacts with CEP215 to retain it on the peripheral pericentriolar material, inhibiting centriole separation following disengagement (25503564)
functional_category: microtubule organizing center organization; centrosome cycle; centriole-centriole cohesion; centriolar satellite

functional_summary: Regulation of the centrosomal localisation of -tubulin complex components, CG-NAP, and Kiz. Cep72 provides centrosomal microtubule-nucleation activity and has critical roles in spindle-pole formation, whichis needed for proper tension generation between sister chromatids during mitosis (19536135). Recruitment of Cep290 to centriolar satellites by interaction with PCM1. Regulates ciliary recruitment and relocalisation of BBS4 from centriolar satellites to primary cilia during ciliogenesis, which affects assembly and recruitment of the BBSome (22767577).
functional_category: microtubule organizing center organization; spindle organization; centrosome cycle; protein-containing complex localization; centriole assembly; membraneless organelle assembly; centrosome duplication; centriole replication; protein localization to microtubule cytoskeleton; protein localization to centrosome; protein localization to microtubule organizing center; protein localization to cytoskeleton; regulation of protein localization to centrosome; centriolar satellite

functional_summary: Centrosome overduplication by interaction with the N- terminal catalytic domain of Plk4 (27246242). Regulation of centrosome homeostasis by inhibiting the final step of the enzymatic reaction catalyzed by EDD

functional_summary: Recruitment of distal appendages proteins like SCLT1 and CEP89 (23348840). CEP83 phosphorylation mediated by TTBK2, regulates docking of membrane vesicles to mother centrioles, promoting CP110 removal and cilia initiation. Mutation have been associated with infantile nephronophthisis (31455668).

functional_summary: Also calles CEP13 and CCDC123. Assembly of primary cilium and membrane docking (23348840). It interacts with the centriolar satellite proteins PCM-1 and OFD1 for cilia formation, and with Cep290 for the recruitment of membranes to the centrosome. CEP123 is required for the formation of a ciliary vesicle at the distal end of the mother centriole during primary ciliogenesis (23789104)
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; non-motile cilium assembly; motile cilium; centriole; non-motile cilium; spindle; spindle pole

functional_summary: Recruitment and stabilisation of CP110 to centrosomes. Both CP110 and CEP97 complexes regulate basal body function, centrosome functions and inhibit cilia assembly (17719545). Loss of CEP97 causes premature cilia formation or abnormal centriole elongation (30375385). CEP97 ubiquitylation and degradation play a key role in the removal of the CEP97CP110 complex from the mother centriole for initiating ciliary axoneme extension (30404837).

functional_summary: Synthesis and accumulation of CETN2 is required for centriole duplication (12176356). Regulation of primary ciliogenesis through controlling CP110 levels and localisation (25753040). Stabilisation of connecting cilium axoneme structure. CETN2 is required for photoreceptor survival by regulating SPATA7 CC localization, distal connecting cilium/axoneme microtubule stability, and outer segment disc orientation (30647131)

CETN3 restrains centriole assembly by inhibiting Mps1 kinase activity at centrosomes and phosphorylation of both the specific substrate CETN2 (26354417)

description: cilia and flagella associated protein 52 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:16053]
functional_summary:
Also called WDR16. Wdr16 can be considered a differentiation marker of kinociliaearing cells. In the 
brain, it appears to be functionally related to water homeostasis or osmoregulation. It might be speculated that Wdr16 has some role in cilia-mediated cell polarity (17394468). CFAP52 protein has been proposed to play a role in cilia-related signal transduction processes and mutations have been known as a cause of either heterotaxy or situs inversus without Primary Ciliary Dyskinesia, suggesting a role in human laterality patterning (32111882, 25469542).

description: ciliogenesis and planar polarity effector complex subunit 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:25801]
functional_summary: Also known as JBTS17. Most common mutated gene in Joubert syndrome and the related oral-facial-digital syndrome type VI (OFDVI). (29321670). JBTS17 contributes to mitotic progression by interacting with LIS1, its depletion disrupts chromosome alignment and spindle pole orientation, resulting in mitotic delay (31004438). JBTS17 acts upstream of NPHP1 in the assembly of the NPHP1-4-8 complex in the cilia transition zone, it is required for efficient SHH signaling and for establishing cell polarity (25877302).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; ciliary transition zone

description: ciliogenesis and planar polarity effector complex subunit 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:28127]
functional_summary: Also called RSG1. Regulator of ciliogenesis, including apical trafficking of basal bodies and the cytoplasmatic localisation and axonemal dynamics of retrograde intraflagellar transport proteins IFT-A protein IFT43 (24192041). Component of the CPLANE complex and acts at increasing the efficiency of primary cilia initiation in a late step. RSG1 activity promotes assembly of the microtubule axoneme after the mother centriole has docked onto the ciliary vesicle and accelerates the rate of elongation of the young axoneme. Only gene identified to date in which null mutations cause the production of fewer primary cilia of normal length and without a detectable defect in ciliary trafficking (29038301)

functional_summary: Epithelial polarity, tight junction formation and ciliogenesis. CRB3-CLPI isoform interacts with importin -1 to be delivered to spindle poles during cell division and ciliogenesis, and this delivery may be important for centrosomemaintenance (17646395). It modulates intraflagellar transport and cilia elongation together with Par3/Par6/aPKC polarity complex (28882989, 15324661)

functional_summary: Mammalian G-protein coupled receptor (GPCR) with high affinity for corticotropin-releasing hormone (CRH) and the CRH family of peptides, involved in neurotransmitters signaling. Component of ciliogenesis pathways. Studies suggest that GPCRs may regulate endocytic membrane trafficking, playing sensory or signalling roles in the ciliary vesicle or procilium at the earliest stages of ciliogenesis both in the developing brain and in other tissues.

functional_summary: Structural component of the ciliary rootlet. Coiled-coil interaction in the extended -helical rod domain of rootletin is a key feature in rootlet formation (12427867). Interaction between the rootlet and intermediate filaments may contribute substantially to the role as support structure for the cillium. Candidate gene for human retinal degeneration (15870283). interacts with the large coiled-coil protein, C-NAP1, to connect parental centrioles and maintain centrosome cohesion. Positive regulation of ciliogenesis (23070519). CHE-10/rootletin maintains ciliary integrity by modulating the assembly, motility, and flux of IFT particles, which are critical for axoneme length control; and is essential for stabilizing ciliary transition zones and basal bodies (24094853)

description: centrosome and spindle pole associated protein 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:26193]
functional_summary: CSPP proteins may be involved in cytoskeletal organization and for correct localisation of NPHP8 to the tip of the basal body that is forming the transition zone (20519441). Interacts with CEP104 at microtubules for the regulation of axoneme length and Hedgehog pathway stimulation (31412255). CSPP1 is required for localization of axonemal proteins, such as ARL13B and AC3; loss of CSPP1 is a cause of Joubert syndrome (24360808).

functional_summary: Component of the intercentrosomal linker and a key regulator of mitotic centrosome separation (18086858). Required for Kupffer vesicle (KV) and cilia formation, and organ laterality. Ctnnb1/2 activity in dorsal forerunner cells is required for cilia formation by controlling the expression of a set of transcription factors (22535411). Interacts with TCF family members, activating Wnt target genes (15852005). Ciliary deconstruction initiates the formation of metastasising melanoma by promoting WNT/-catenin signaling (30008323).

functional_summary: Promotes both actin polymerization and EB1- dependent microtubule (MT) stability, both actin nucleating and microtubule-stabilizing properties of DIAPH1 are important for their cilia functions. Depletion of DIAPH1 decreased ciliogenesis, cilia length, and reduced trafficking within cilia. Conversely, targeting of DIAPH1 specifically to the basal body causes an increase in cilia length and increased trafficking within cilia. Thought to regulate cilia maintenance in part by regulating vesicular trafficking to the base of the primary cilia (33124112)

functional_summary: Highly conserved WD-repeat protein which acts as part of a chaperone complex involved in pre-assembly of axonemal dynein in the cytoplasm. Required for motile ciliogenesis in planarian Schmidtea mediterranea, knockdowns have partial loss of dynein arms (26912790). Works with the DNAAF Spag1 at a distinct stage in dynein preassembly to regulate cytoplasmic pre- assembly of ciliary dynein in Drosophila (29743191). Functions with the HSP90 co-chaperone R2TP-like complex and other DNAAFs in axonemal dynein preassembly in the cytoplasm of Chlamydomonas (30428028). Stablises axonemal dynein heavy chains in cytoplasm in Chlamydomonas (31116681)

functional_summary: Vertebrate orthologue of Chlamydomonas intermediate chain inner dynein arm protein IC140 which localises to Chlamydomonas flaggelar axoneme (9843573). In Chlamydomonas interacts with IC138 (WDR78 in vertebrates) and directly interacts with tubulin (24080090). Associates with inner dynein arm subunit Wdr78 in mice (30060180). Rare intragenic heterozygous in-frame WDR63 deletion identified as likely cause of occipital encephalocele in one human fetus (29285825). Similar mutations in zebrafish caused similar malformations (29285825). Also interacts with Arp2/3 to regulate actin polymerisation and inhibit cell migration, invasion, and metastasis (32128961)

functional_summary: Identified as a putative cilia gene by proteomics and comparative genomics (15937072), characterised as a cilia protein via siRNA knockdown of Wdr78 in 3 different mouse cell lines and high content imaging which showed perturbed receptor transport to the ciliary membrane and HH signalling (21289087). Vertebrate orthologue of Chlamydomonas inner dynein arm protein IC138. Associates with inner dynein arm subunits such as Dnah2 (a heavy chain) and Wdr63 (Chlamydomonas IC140 orthologue) in mice. Localises specifically to motile cilia in mice and knockdown leads to immotility of ependymal cilia with failure of heavy chains and intermediate chains of inner dynein arms to localise to motile cilia 30060180 . Zebrafish Wdr78 morphants have ciliopathy- type phenotypes (30060180).

functional_summary: Structural component of the nexin-dynein regulatory complex (N-DRC), critical for regulation of the dynein motors. Its integrity is essential for the regulation of ciliary beat. Mutations are a cause for an autosomal recessive variant of primary ciliary dyskinesia (23354437). DRC1 and DRC2 form a subcomplex in the cytoplasm prior to assembly into the axoneme. DRC1 and DRC2 coassemble to form a central scaffold needed for assembly of the N-DRC and its attachment to the outer doublet (29167384). Loss of function of DRC1 may weaken the NRC and its attachment to the peripheral microtubules, leading to axonemal microtubule disorganization (31960620).

Its location suggests that DRC3 could be important for transducing regulatorysignals from the radial spokes through the base plate of the N-DRC to the dynein motor (25564608).

functional_summary: Central linker subunit that helps connect the N-DRC to the outer dynein arms. Loss of DRC7 causes defects in sperm storage and fertility (31659045). DRC7 is essential to localize DRC5 in the correct place, and that DRC5 regulates flagellar motility (31961863)

functional_summary: Dynein intermediate chain associated with the retrograde intraflagellar transport motor dynein 2 (25205765). Orthologous to Chlamydomonas FAP133 and Trypanosome DIC5 (24989795). Homozygous missense mutations cause short-rib polydactyly syndrome type III/severe asphyxiating thoracic dysplasia (OMIM:; 24183449; 24183451). Acts as a TAK1-associated suppressor of the IL- 1R/TLR3/TLR4-induced NF- B activation pathway. Patient fibroblast cilia are short with a bulbous tip (24183449). Localises around basal bodies, centrioles and along the axoneme (24183451). Interacts with DYNLL1 and DYNLL2 (25294941), TCTEX1D2 (25830415). Required for retrograde IFT and Hedgehog signalling in mouse (28379358). WDR34 KO cells can assemble a dynein-2 motor complex that binds IFT proteins yet fails to extend an axoneme (30320547). Incorporation of DYNLL1/DYNLL2 and DYNLRB1/DYNLRB2 into the dynein-2 complex via interactions with the WDR34 intermediate chain is crucial for dynein-2 function in retrograde ciliary protein trafficking (30649997); Dynein 2 intermediate chain. Biallelic truncating, frameshift or missense mutations cause autosomal recessive short-rib thoracic dysplasia type 8 with or without polydactyly (OMIM:615462) (23910462). Localizes to the base of the cilium in human chondrocytes (23910462), RPE1 cells (25205765) and HEK293 cells (25830415). Ciliogenesis is inhibited in fibroblasts from affected patients, GLI2 accumulates at basal body (23910462). Stability of WDR34 and WDR60 is interdependent (25205765). Localises to the centrosome in interphase, the spindle poles during mitosis and cytokinesis, and near the cytokinetic bridge during cytokinesis in HeLa cells (25830415). Interaction with TCTEX1D2 light chain of the dynein-2 complex is crucial for ciliary protein trafficking. (29742051).WDR60 KO cells extend axonemes but show reduced assembly of dynein-2 and binding to IFT proteins. Required to maintain a functional transition zone and for efficient bidirectional intraflagellar transport (30320547; 30649997). Structure resolved in 31451806

functional_summary: Dynein-2 light chain, required for cilia function. Associates with WDR34 (25205765) and WDR60, which is required for ciliary protein trafficking, as KO cells show defects in retrograde ciliary protein trafficking (29742051). Causative gene for short-rib polydactyly syndromes. Associates with Dync2h1 and other subunits of the Dync2 complex to deliver specific cargo necessary for ciliogenesis to the base of the cilium (25830415). Mutations cause Jeune asphyxiating thoracic dystrophy (26044572).

description: DAZ interacting zinc finger protein 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:20908]
functional_summary: Mediates membrane/basal- body interactions, functions in basal-body maturation and transition zone organisation. Required to recruit Fam92 and Cby at the basal body distal end, allowing proper transition zone assembly; both DZIP and FARM92 control the distal elongation of basal bodies and docking to the plasma membrane (31821146, 32491167). Mediates the assembly of the BBSome-Dzip1-PCM1 complex in the centriolar satellites for ciliary translocation of the BBSome (27979967). Necessary for recruiting IFT machinery to the distal appendages of the mother centrioles and for bridging IFT88 to the cargo that contains GLI3. Positive regulator of Shh (23955340). Together with GSK3 and Rab8, DZIP1 co- regulates ciliogenesis by promoting ciliary membrane assembly (25860027).

functional_summary: Requiered for ciliogenesis by regulating activation and repression of the Sonic hedgehog (SHH) signalling pathway. Trafficking of SHH signaling components to the primary cilia; its activations leads to entry of SMO into cilia (26884322). Role in ciliary vesicles assembly. Formation of membrane tubules that attach the intracellular developing cilium to the cell surface and create an extracellular membrane channel (EMC). Recruitment of PACSIN proteins to cellular membranes (30683896). Responsible for removal of the capping protein CP110 from the m- centriole to facilitate ciliary growth. Function in early ciliogenesis by causing mother centriole reorganisation. Regulation of membrane tubulation required for ciliary vesicle formation from smaller distal appendage vesicles. EHD1 and EHD3 bind to the Rab8 effector MICAL-L1 and affect membrane tubulo-vesicle formation and scission (25686250).

functional_summary: Mutated in Huntington's Disease. Scaffolding protein required for vesicular transport via interactions with microtubules and motor protein cargo adaptors such as HAP1 and dynactin. Functional role in autophagy (26160070). Essential for protein trafficking to the centrosome and normal ciliogenesis. Retrograde trafficking of PCM1 regulated by HTT and HAP1 to control ciliogenesis (21985783).

description: HYDIN axonemal central pair apparatus protein [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:19368]
functional_summary: Candidate for hydrocephalus in humans and primary ciliary dyskinesia (23022101). Interacts with the central pair proteins CPC1 and kinesin- like protein 1 (KLP1). Required for flagellar motility. Regulation of contact with the radial spokes dynein arm activity (17296796). Lack of Hydin causes deficiency on ciliary orientation and reduced alignment of neighboring cilia, as it is involved in regulating the dynein arms during the transitions between effective and recovery strokes (18250199).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; microtubule-based movement; cilium movement; axoneme assembly; microtubule bundle formation; respiratory system development; ventricular system development; epithelial cell development; trachea development; ciliary plasm; axoneme; plasma membrane bounded cell projection cytoplasm; cytoplasmic region

description: HYLS1 centriolar and ciliogenesis associated [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:26558]
functional_summary: Required for intraflagellar transport trafficking and for centrioles to form cilia. Loss of HYLS-1 results in severe defects in axoneme assembly and transition zone organisation, due to impaired entry of IFT machinery to the cilia via DYF-19 (28411189). Ciliogenesis mediation by regulating the formation of the ciliary gate; minor role in transition zone assembly. Required for distal centriole elongation and recruiting distal centriole proteins (32509774). Essential for the apical targeting and/or anchoring of centrioles/basal body at the plasma membrane, contributin to basal body organisation (19656802).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; centriole; non-motile cilium

functional_summary: Negative regulator of the Shh pathway, controlling the ciliary localization of Shh pathway activators and repressors. Loss of IFT122 causes accumulation of Gli2 and Gli3 at cilia tips. Function in retrograde intraflagellar transport (ITF) that facilitates complex A stability (21209331). Required for transport of opsin, and the distal elongation of outer segments (27681595). IFT122 connects the core and peripheral subcomplexes of the IFT-A (29220510).

functional_summary: Component of IFT-A complex, mutated in skeletal ciliopathies with kidney disease (23418020). Associates with IFT122 and IFT144 to a stable IFT-A core subcomplex; indispensable for dynein proteins retrograde transport into the cytoplasm and flagellar assembly. Required for development and maintenance of outer segments, ciliary/flagellar assembly and signal transduction (29236364, 24619649).

Essential for ciliary growth and maintenance, and morphogenesis of the cerebral cortex. Mutation cause alterations in multiple intracellular signaling pathways (31850339, 18930042). Mutations are associated with severe skeleto-renal disorders with retinal involvement (25168386).

functional_summary: Also known as RABL5, component of IFT complex B. Controls the cellular levels of both IFT and IFT proteins and to regulate availability of particles participating in IFT (30940671). Recruitment of BBSome to the basal body through BBS3 and regulation of BBSome entry into the cilia (31953262).

functional_summary: Also known as IFT25. Not required in ciliogenesis of somatic cells. Component of IFT-B complex and maight be involved in retrograde transport. Interacts with IFT27 and is indispensable for sperm flagellum axoneme formation, integrity and stability in mice, as well as contributing to the trafficking of signalling molecules via BBSome complex. (28430876, 28964737, 30709917). Regulation of ciliary trafficking of Hh pathway components, including Patched-1, Smoothened, and Gli2 (26023097, 22595669).

functional_summary: Also known as RABL4, component of IFT complex B. Forms a complex with IFT25 and associates with IFT-B inside cilia, interacts with and stabilises the nucleotide-free form of ARL6 to promote the exit of BBSome out of cilia. Mutated in Bardet-Biedl syndrome (25443296). Required for BBSome trafficking essential for hedgehog signaling. IFT25/IFT27 complex plays a role in transporting Gli2 to the ciliary tip (25446516). Role in the cargo loading of the retrograde transport machinery (24843028).

functional_summary: Component of IFT complex A. Mutations leads to abnormal ciliogenesis (28973684). Interacts with IFT121 to regulate stability of IFT-A, and is essential for ciliogenesis. Involved in transporting ciliary precursors from the cytoplasmic pool to the peri-basal body region (28207750)

functional_summary: Component of IFT complex B, required for ciliogenesis and controls cilia number and length (25722189). Plas a role in the transport of IFT proteins between the cytoplasm and cilia (29915351). IFT46 is crucial for transport of ODA16 into the flagellum; it interacts with IFT52 to assembly a subcomplex which is a prerequisite for the assembly of IFT-B1 (28701346).

functional_summary: Component of IFT complex B. Essential for anterograde complex integrity, biosynthesis and maintenance of cilia. Regulation of ciliogenesis and cilia length; it also plays a role as a docking site for complex B proteins attaching to the transition fibres of the basal bodies and is required for localization of the IFT-B complex proteins (27466190). Recruits and interacts with IFT46 to assembly a subcomplex which is a prerequisite for the assembly of IFT-B1, it is also required to localise IFT46 to the basal body (28302912).

functional_summary: Also known as IFT56. Regulates normal levels and distribution of IFTB proteins in the cilia. Required for the accumulation of Gli2 and Gli3 at the distal tips of cilia; essential for normal microtubule architecture within the ciliary axoneme and trafficking of Shh signaling proteins. IFT56 associates with motility factors, function results in impaired motility (28264835). Required for normal development and differentiation in retina and pronephros (22718903). Role in transporting ciliary cargoes related to ciliary motility and for assembling cilia of full length (24596149). Forms a dimer with IFT46, responsible for the interaction of IFT-B with ARL13B (27927754).

Mediates the interaction between IFT20 and the IFT particle (18492793). Trafficking of motility-related proteins and prevents IFT particle complex from degradation (28104816).

This interaction is required for binding and transport of tubulin to regulate cilium length, required for ciliogenesis (23990561). Essential for normal mouse spermatogenesis and sperm flagella formation by transporting cargo proteins and modulating axoneme and microtubule assembly (31004481).

Silencing IFT80 led to either shortening or loss of cilia and the decrease of cilia marker protein Arl13b expression. Mutations cause Jeune asphyxiating thoracic dystrophy (JATD) and short rib polydactyly type III (SRPIII) (22771375). Required for IFT mediated recruitment and transport of ciliary cargo, as well as for initiation of the ciliary axoneme (29658880).

functional_summary: Also known as NPHP5. Required for extension of an axoneme after docking of the basal body to the cell membrane. NPHP5-binding to the BBSome is crucial for BBSome integrity and ciliary trafficking (25552655).

description: katanin catalytic subunit A1 like 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:25387]

functional_summary: Substrate-adaptor for Cul3- RING E3 ligases (CRL3s) that modulates polyubiquitylation of trichoplein and enables cells to assemble primary cilia by limiting Aurora-A activity. KCTD17 is required to initiate the axoneme extension during ciliogenesi (25270598).

functional_summary: Negative regulator of ciliogenesis required for the controlled recruitment of IFT proteins into cilia through the modulation of actin dynamics. It binds to the actin cytoskeleton, creating a responsive actin gate involving ARP2/3 activity and regulating IFT within cilia and periciliary compartments. In the absence of KDM3A, access to cilia is unrestricted, so the assembly and growth of primary cilia is enhanced (28246120).

functional_summary: Required for ciliogenesis and sonic hedgehog/SHH signaling. Role in primary cilia formation and microtubule organisation (19144723). Component of a CP110-containing protein complex required for centrosome and cilia function, Required for the centrosomal recruitment of RAB8A and for the targeting of centriole satellite proteins to centrosomes such as of PCM1. May play a role in early ciliogenesis in the disappearance of centriolar satellites that preceeds ciliary vesicle formation. Essential for centrosomal migration prior to ciliogenesis (24421332). Mutated in Joubert syndrome (26096313) and in skeletal ciliopathies (31816441; 32080096)
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; smoothened signaling pathway; ciliary basal body; centriole; photoreceptor inner segment

functional_summary: Mutated cause impaired ciliogenesis and result in Joubert Syndrome. Regulates centriole duplication positively by recruiting CDK2 to the centrosome, as well as WDR62 to the pericentriolar complex, which in turn recruits CEP63; interacts with CEP63, and regulate CEP63 level at the centrosome(28220259, 24613305). Also cause skeletal ciliopathies (31816441; 29138412).

functional_summary: Mutations are associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa (30120214).

functional_summary: Essential for establishment of a CAV1 membrane microdomain at the transition zone and promotes Sonic hedgehog signalling. Regulates transition zone membrane composition and ciliary SMO accumulation. Recruited to the ciliary base by NPHP4 (28134340).

functional_summary: Regulator of chromosome segregation, cytokinesis and midbody formation. Regulator of cilia formation, basal body biogenesis and Hedgehog (HH) signaling. Depletion of KIF14 specifically leads to defects in ciliogenesis and basal body biogenesis (32348467). Mutations in humans and zebrafish cause ciliopathy-like kidney and microcephaly phenotypes (30388224; 24128419)

functional_summary: Also known as KIF19A. Controls ciliary length through its microtubule depolymerising activity. It also has a role in microtubule- based active motility toward the plus-end (27690357). Maintains the optimal length of motile cilia by depolymerising microtubules newly polymerised from axoneme at ciliary tips (23168168).

functional_summary: Physiological substrate of Nek2. It prevents the outgrowth of cilia in proliferating cells. Ensure the disassembly of a ciliary axoneme in the later stages of the cell cycle (26290419). Interacts with CP110 and Cep97. Regulates ciliogenesis by dynamically controlling microtubule polymerisation (21620453). Controls the formation of primary cilia by restricting the nucleation of cilia at centrioles, it regulates CP110 localisation at mother centrioles (21663786).

functional_summary: Essential for planarian ciliogenesis (19933103). Kif27 expression is upregulated during mouse tracheal epithelial cells differentiation, consistent with their essential roles in motile ciliogenesis (19305393). Interacts with Fu and both may regulate central pair assembly, probably through the recruitment or activation of central pair proteins such as Spag16 and Pcdp1. It could also interact with basal body components or accessory structures in controlling cilia orientation (23907739).

functional_summary: Promotes the primary cilium disassembly through its microtubule-depolymerising activity at the mother centriole, coupled with cell proliferation and blocking inappropriate ciliogenesis during the cycling phase. Controls the cytoplasmic tubulin concentration to regulate primary cilia disassembly (25660017). Mutations cause primary microcephaly. Recruited by CEP170 (31197141).

functional_summary: Required for cilia assembly, function and organisation of subdistal appendiges of centrioles. Recruits p150Glued to the subdistal appendages of mother centrioles, critical for centrosomes to function as microtubule-organising centres and to recruit other subdistal appendage components such as Ninein and Cep170. Loss of Kif3a abrogates microtubule anchoring and ciliary basal foot formation (23386061).

functional_summary: Mediator of ciliogenesis and normal cilia beating in ependmal cells in vertebrates. Mutations are reported to be associated with neurological abnormalities in humans (30475797).

functional_summary: Negative regulator of Hedgehog signalling at cilia in mammals by controlling the activity of Gli and Sufu. Controls the localization of Hh signaling complexes through its ability to regulate the dynamics of microtubule plus- ends. It inhibits microtubule growth to regulate the length of axonemal microtubules at the ciliary tip and control cilia structure (24981634, 24952464, 19592253). A conserved non- motile kinesin, Kif7 defines a "cilium-tip compartment" by localizing to the distal ends of axonemal microtubules; preferentially binds GTP- tubulin at microtubule ends over GDP-tubulin in the mature microtubule lattice (31031197)

functional_summary: Required for ciliary membrane protein transport and serum starvationnduced ciliogenesis. Role in the Golgi transport of membrane proteins from the Golgi complex to the primary cilium and in the recruitment of ciliogenesis regulators and maintenance. Required for TTBK2 recruitment and CP110 removal from the distal end of the mother centriole to iniciate cilium assembly (29042452).

functional_summary: Interacts with PLK1 in order to protect the centrosome from collapsing during spindle formation in mitosis. KIZ might have a critical role in this trafficking process. Mutations lead to autosomal- recessive Rod-Cone Dystrophy (24680887).

Mutations cause retinal degeneration, including cone dystrophy and autosomal recessive retinitis pigmentosa (29673930, 21606596, 18826961). Interacts with a nearly complete IFT complex B particle, as well as with some IFT complex A proteins (21606596).

functional_summary: Recruits the keratin-binding protein FBF1. Promotes cilia biogenesis in CP110- uncapped centrioles by organising centriolar satellites. It is required for centrosome cohesion at the proximal end of centrioles. Establishes the transition zone, recruitment of Rab8 and satellites to centrosomes, and promotes the docking of Rab8 GTPase-positive vesicles to the mother centriole (30131441).
functional_category: Unknown

functional_summary: Interacts with the intraflagellar transport (IFT) protein IFT88. Required for the transport and addition of dynein arms to the distal end of the flagellum during cilia assembly. Mutations result in a disease entity within the group of mucociliary clearance disorders and loss of ciliary motility (30388400).
functional_category: Unknown

functional_summary: Phosphorylates Rab8A, Rab10 and Rab12, mutations interferer with primary cilia formation by generating pRab10 that binds endogenous RILPL1 and blocks cilia formation. Regulates intracellular vesicular traffic during ciliogenesis (30398148, 29125462).

functional_summary: Interacts with a BBS protein complex known as the BBSome to negatively regulate ciliary trafficking of this complex inhibiting BBSome ciliary entry. functional_summary: Role in coordination of actin and microtubules; critical in ciliogenesis, maintenance and regulation of apicobasal polarity. functional_summary: Mutations cause nephronophthisis (NPHP9); it can be transported into cilia by Inv (20169535). Controls or modulates the ciliary localization of PC1 and PC2, as well as ciliary length (18235101). It is speculated that Nek8 activity may be required to initiate ciliogenesis, and degradation may be required to prevent it (22106379). Component of the PC2 channel complex required to mediate nodal calcium flux, indispensable for the establishment of left-right asymmetry (23274954).

description: neuralized E3 ubiquitin protein ligase 4 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:34410]
functional_summary: Controls CP110 levels at mother centriole. It transiently traslocates to mother centriole to remove CP110 and facilitate proximily between both centrioles and and promote axoneme formation (28385950). Promotes ubiquitylation of CP110 to maintain centrosome homeostasis and prevent the formation of ectopic microtubular organizing centres (22441691).

description: outer dynein arm docking complex subunit 4 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:25280]
functional_summary: Member of the ODA-docking complex in humans and mice. Plays an essential role in the correct function of motile cilia and is therefore important for the development of left-right patterning. Mutations result in PCD and randomisation of left-right body asymmetry. TTC25 deficiency in mice leads to absence of ODA (27486780). May interacts with CFAP53 to facilitate ODA proteins transport into the axoneme and regulate its stable docking with the axonemal microtubules (33347437). TTC25 morphant cells show fewer and extremely shorter cilia. (17961536).

functional_summary: Associated with oral-facial- digital type I syndrome. Absence of the Ofd1 protein leads to basal body dysfunction, which in turn prevents the assembly of the primary cilium, and causes failure of left-right axis specification (16311594). It associates with the distal ends of centriolar microtubules to build distal appendages, recruit Ift88, and stabilise centriole length and regulate ciliogenesis (20230748). Its presence at the centriolar satellite suppresses primary ciliogenesis and removal of OFD1 by autophagy promotes it (24089205).

description: par-3 family cell polarity regulator [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:16051]
functional_summary: Also called PAR3. Interacts with Par6 and aPKC to form a polarity complex that regulates the stability of the ciliary axoneme (15324661). It is required for the elongation of primary cilia, possibly by facilitating anterograde transport of cargo. Interacts with Kif3a, anterograde motor for IFT (18070914, 25144710). PAR3 is also required for apical localisation of centrosome and may also be involved in the proper orientation of the axoneme (20138861).

functional_summary: Also called USH1F. Mutations cause retinitis pigmentosa in Usher syndrome type 1F and non-syndromic hearing loss (14570705). It may be involved in the development or maintenance of the stereocilia bundles on the apical surface of hair cells (11138007). It is also speculated to play a role in regulation of planar polarity in neurosensory cells (11487575), probably through the activation of Rhoa (28883094).

functional_summary: Centriolar satellite protein/component that serves as a scaffold to target proteins to centrosome during centrosome maturation. When phosphorylated, it recruits Plk1 to the pericentriolar matrix before mitotic entry (23345402). Involved in the formation of primary cilia by associating with CEP290 and BBSome during the ciliogenesis: required for ciliary localisation of Rab8. Role in the recruitment of major centrosomal proteins required for the formation of the non-motile primary cilium (18772192, 31023719). Depletion reduces ciliogenesis (21985783). Its localisation is dependent on BBS4, mislocalisation leads to deanchoring of centrosomal microtubules (15107855). Required for focal ciliary integrity (33214552)

description: phosphatidylinositol-4-phosphate 3-kinase catalytic subunit type 2 alpha [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:8971]
functional_summary: Mutations cause syndromic short stature, skeletal abnormalities, and cataracts associated with ciliary dysfunction (31034465). Critical for the formation of cilia and for receptor mediated endocytosis. Promotes the activation and pericentriolar localisation of Rab11+ vesicles, triggers the Rab8- dependent pathway and translocation of Smo to the primary cilium. Controls the production of PtdIns3P at the endocytic recycling compartment located at the base of the primary cilium (24697898). PI3KC2- dependent and VPS34- independent generation of PI3P controls primary cilium- mediated autophagy in response to shear stress (31941925).

functional_summary: Also known as PC2. Mutation causes autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (PKD). Dimerizes with PKD2 to form a channel in the ciliary membrane (20392267) and mediate transduction of an extracellular mechanical stimulus into a Ca2+ signaling response involved in the differentiation of kidney tubular epithelial cells (12514735, 26788466). Required for the asymmetric localization of Vangl2 and involved in the establishment of the asymmetric positioning of planar cell polarity proteins (26245976).

description: PKHD1 ciliary IPT domain containing fibrocystin/polyductin [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:9016]
functional_summary: Also known as FPC. Functional and/or structural component of primary cilia in kidney tubular cells (14978161). Mutations are involved in utosomal recessive polycystic kidney disease (15458427, 11898128, 14983006). PKHD1 may associate with a common pathway that alters ciliary function and cation channel activity and may act as an intraflagellar motor-binding protein. description: RAB34, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:16519]
functional_summary: Rab34 regulates the early steps in serum starvation- induced ciliogenesis in hTERT-RPE1 cells, through a unique N-terminal region, by regulating the ciliary vesicle fusion step and/or the subsequent expansion. Required for ciliogenesis in only certain cell types (32669361). Rab34 is required for the successive fusion of small preciliary vesicles in order to generate ciliary vesicles, it is also required for the migration of the mother centriole from perinuclear region to cell membrane. Required for an early step of ciliary vesicle formation and Hh signaling in vivo. Mutation results in significant decrease of ciliogenesis in both cultured cells and mice (30301781). Potential transcriptional target of Gli transcription factors (17442700).

functional_summary: Also known as Rabin8. GTP loading by Rabin8 promotes Rab8 association with post- Golgi vesicles and targets them to polarised areas of the plasma membrane. BBS1 subunit of the BBSome associates with the C terminus of Rabin8 at the basal body. Activates Rab8 by loading with GTP, which is necessary for Rab8 to enter the primary cilium, promoting ciliogenesis and apical membrane formation (17574030). Phosphorylation of Rabin8 might modulate its interactions with ASAP1 and Rab11a. It binds to the catalytically active ASAP1 in complex with Rab11a and FIP3 (25673879). Interacts with Chibby to promote recruitment of Rab8 and efficient assembly of ciliary vesicles. Interaction with Rab11 stimulates its GEF activity (25313408) and is required for Rabin8 preciliary membrane trafficking to the centrosome and for ciliogenesis (21273506).

description: RAB8A, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:7007]
functional_summary: Rab8 targets vesicles to the cilium and promotes ciliary membrane elongation. It is activated by Rabin8 (17574030, 22433857). Inactivating Rab8 (GDP- bound state) blocks ciliogenesis and induces BBS phenotypes in zebrafish (17574030). Rab8a, Rab8b and Rab10 work synergistically for ciliogenesis (24213529). Rab8a specifically interacts with cenexin/ODF2, a basal body and microtubule binding protein required for cilium biogenesis (17646400). Regulates the trafficking of rhodopsin in photoreceptors. Interacts with RPGR which regulates its activity and localisation. Involved in polarised trafficking of vesicles from the trans-Golgi network (20631154). Involved in serum-starvation-induced ciliogenesis (32669361)

description: rabaptin, RAB GTPase binding effector protein 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:24817]
functional_summary: RABEP2 localization at the centrosome is regulated by SDCCAG8. As a component of cilium, it may be a component of the intraciliary transport mechanism. siRNA mediated knockdown in hTERT-RPE1 cells abolished cilia formation, indicating a critical role in ciliogenesis (27224062).

description: RAB, member of RAS oncogene family like 2A [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:9799]
functional_summary: RABL2 paralog. Functionally redundant with RABL2B as they can rescue ciliogenesis when both genes have been knocked out (28625565). Associates with ciliary GPCR in mammalian primary cilia and regulates theirs localisation (30578315). Two variants in RABL2A were identified as cause of male infertility and ciliopathy (33075816). RABL2 might play a role in trafficking of ciliary proteins as well as ciliogenesis. RABL2A/B knock out lead to decrease in number of primary cilia in RPE1 cells (30578315).
functional_category: guanyl nucleotide binding; guanyl ribonucleotide binding; GTP binding; GTPase activity

description: RAB, member of RAS oncogene family like 2B [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:9800]
functional_summary: RABL2 paralog. Functionally redundant with RABL2A as they can rescue ciliogenesis when both genes have been knocked out (28625565). Associates with ciliary GPCR in mammalian primary cilia and regulates theirs localisation (30578315). It is recruited by CEP19 to the ciliary base where it mediates release of IFT-B from pre-docked complexes to initiate IFT ciliary entry; CEP19-RABL2B complex is then a critical regulator that initiates intraflagellar transport at the ciliary base (28625565). Variant in RABL2B gene could be a risk factor in Iranian infertile men with oligoasthenoteratozoospermia (28138870).

functional_summary: Ran GTP regulates ciliary protein transport and ciliogenesis (21998203). RanGTP gradient regulates trafficking and entry of kinesin motor KIF17 into cilium. It has been proposed that Ran plays a role in regulating cellular compartmentalisation by controlling the shuttling of cytoplasmic proteins into ciliary compartments (20526328). Interacts with Importin 2, which interacts directly with cargoes, releasing them upon binding Ran GTP and regulating localisation of RP2 (21285245).

functional_summary: Negative regulator of Ran GTP, as it stimulates Ran GTP to GDP conversion. RanBP1 Knockdown results in an increased concentration of Ran GTP at basal bodies, leading to ciliogenesis. Overexpression antagonizes primary cilia formation.

functional_summary: Negative regulator of calcineurin and modulates Ca2+ dependent signalling. Required to maintain normal cilia length. Depletion in WT RPE-1 cells results in shorter cilia, whilst in giantin KO cells induces longer cilia (29643119).
functional_category: calcium-mediated signaling

functional_summary: Involved in regulation of ALMS1 in vivo, by binding its promoter (20381594). Coordinates multiple, distinct gene expression programs in MCCs, regulating genes encoding axonemal dynein subunits, components of the transition zone anb BBSome, centriolar genes and planar cell polarity (PCP) effector fritz/wdpcp. It also regulates the extracellular matrix component dag1, which is a regulator of MCC insertion (24424412). Critical regulator of vertebrate ciliogenesis. Knockdown results in phenotypes associated with defective cilia, such as disruption of neural tube closure and leftight asymmetry (22227339).

functional_summary: Highly expressed in Brain. RFX7 controls positively the formation of cilia by regulating the expression of RFX4 gene. Involved in complete neural tube closure (24530844).
functional_category: RNA polymerase II core promoter sequence-specific DNA binding

functional_summary: Cilia-specific GPCR essential for vision. Multiple roles in trafficking, interacts with Arf4, TcTex-1 and SARA (23966685). Mutations cause protein misfolding and retention in the endoplasmic reticulum, leading to cellular stress and cell death. Mutations are associated with retinitis pigmentosa (32343782).

description: Rab interacting lysosomal protein like 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:26814]
functional_summary: Rab effector-related protein, regulates protein concentration by removal of membrane proteins from the cilium. Depletion results in accumulation of signaling proteins in the ciliary membrane, including Smo. Interacts with activated Rab34, Rab36, Rab12 and Rab40B (23264467). Interacts with the LRRK2- phosphorylated forms of Rab8A and Rab10 (29125462). Enhances pRab10 clustering on pericentriolar membranes to suppress ciliogenesis (30398148).

description: Rab interacting lysosomal protein like 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:28787]
functional_summary: Rab effector-related protein that exhibist dynamic localisation; regulates protein concentration by removal of membrane proteins from the cilium.. Depletion results in accumulation of signaling proteins in the ciliary membrane, including Smo. Interacts with activated Rab34 and Rab36 (23264467). Binds to phosphorylated Rab8A, Rab10, and Rab12. As it binds Rab8a much stronger than RILPL1, RILPL2 might be a key effector specific for pRab8A (29125462).

functional_summary: Mutations cause deafness. Interacts with Myh9, which is related to deafness. Regulates the abundance and post translational modifications of proteins highly expressed within the kinocilium , which suggestes a role in hair bundle morphogenesis (30280293).

description: retinal outer segment membrane protein 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:10254]
functional_summary: Outer segment protein. Its localisation depends on AHI1 (20592197). Non- covalently linked PRPH2/ROM1 complex can initiate OS formation, whilst covalent oligomerisation is required for proper OS maturation (32716032, 29961824). Creates and maintains the rim region of rod discs and cone lamellae and help to regulate disc size and alignment (29961824). Homozygous frameshift mutation has been recently associated with pattern dystrophy (30630813).

functional_summary: Functions as a key molecule in the maintenance of basal ciliary beat frequency. Its role in ciliary motility coulb be played via regulation of axonemal signaling (22021175)

functional_summary: Nonsense mutation associated with retinitis pigmentosa (10401003). Microtubule- associated protein containing the doublecortin (DCX) domain. Disruption of Rp1 in mice causes misorientation of outer segment discs, suggesting a role in outer segment organisation. Stimulates microtubule polymerization and stabilise existing microtubules in vitro and in vivo, therefore, it controls the length and stability of the photoreceptor axoneme (15269252). Due to Rp1 localisation, it may be involved in the formation of outer segments (11773008). Plays synergistic role with Rp1L1 in affecting photosensitivity and OS morphogenesis of rod photoreceptors (19657028).

Plays essential and synergistic roles with Rp1 in affecting photosensitivity and OS morphogenesis of rod photoreceptors. Mutations in RP1L1 could underlie retinopathy or modify RP1 disease expression in humans (19657028). Mutations in RP1L1 have been associated with occult macular dystrophy and RP (20826268)

description: RP2 activator of ARL3 GTPase [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:10274]
functional_summary: Interacts with Arl3 and mediates the localization of GFP-Kif17 to the cilia tip and interacts with the regulator of Hedgehog (Hh) signaling Kif7. This suggests RP2 is implicated primary cilia protein trafficking via the regulation of kinesin motor proteins at the ciliary tip (28444310). Loss of RP2 leads to fragmentation of the Golgi network and dispersal of vesicles cycling cargo from the Golgi complex to the cilium, including IFT20. It indicates a role for RP2 in regulating vesicle traffic and docking from the Golgi to the base of the cilium (20106869). Interacts with polycystin 2 and regulates its trafficking within the cilium (20729296). RP2 entry to the ciliary compartiment is regulated by Importin 2 (21285245). Mutations are associated with with X- linked retinitis pigmentosa (9697692).

functional_summary: Role in regulation of nascent disc formation in photoreceptor cilium, by regulating actin-mediated membrane extension. Absence of RPGR impaired ciliogenesis and cell attachment (21933838). Mutations cause type 3 retinis pigmentosa (8673101). RPGR is suggested to regulate cilia function and facilitate the trafficking of proteins along the photoreceptor cilium. Interacts withciliary proteins, such as RPGRIP1, IQCB1, CEP290 and RPGRIP1L, as well as Rab8a (20631154).

functional_summary: Known ciliopathy gene CORD13. Mutations are known causes of RP and Leber congenital amaurosis. Potential structural component of the ciliary axoneme, which anchors RPGR within the cilium (11104772, 15772089). Required for disk morphogenesis and RPGR retention in the connecting cilium (12651948). Essential for rod OS formation, probably by regulating the transport of proteins from the IS to the OS (19679561). Required for ciliary targeting of NPHP4 and SDCCAG8, Rab8 localisation in photoreceptors and is involved in rhodopsin ciliary vesicle transport in zebrafish (29203866).

functional_summary: Mutations cause Joubert (17558407) and Meckel syndrome (17558409). It functions as cilium-specific scaffold that recruits a Nek4 signaling network to regulate cilium assembly and stability. Interacts with RPGR (21685204). Loss of RPGRIP1L in human primary cell cultures and mice increases ciliary axonemal length (30728336). Interacts with MKS and NPHP proteins, and could potentially act as part of the gate for cytoplasmic proteins (30237221). Interacts with Psmd2, regulating the activity of the ciliary proteasome at the transition zone to control ciliary signaling. This proteosomal function could be involved in the control of ciliary length (26150391). Rpgrip1l positively controls dishevelled levels. In the mouse and zebrafish, Rpgrip1l is required for positioning the basal body along the planar polarity axis; morphants display planar cell polarity defects (22927466).

description: ribosomal RNA processing 7 homolog A [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:24286]
functional_summary: Localizes to centrosomes, cilia and nucleoli. Highly expressed in neural stem cells in developing human forebrain, and a missense mutation is associated with microcephaly. Targeted mutation of Rrp7a leads to defects in neurogenesis and proliferation in a mouse stem cell model and in zebrafish causes reduced brain size, impaired neurogenesis and cell proliferation, and defective ribosomal RNA processing. Patient-derived fibroblasts display defects in ribosomal RNA processing, primary cilia resorption, and cell cycle progression (33199730)
functional_category: cilium organization; membraneless organelle assembly; protein localization to nucleus; in utero embryonic development; cellular component disassembly; blastocyst development; organelle disassembly

functional_summary: Mutations have been shown to cause PCD (25473808, 24568568). Integral component of the ciliary axoneme expressed during ciliated cell differentiation (24568568). Mainly expressed in tissues with motile cilia or flagella; absence of RSPH1 leads toabnormal axonemal configuration with central- complex defects, suggesting a role for RSPH1 in proper building of central-complexes and radial spokes (23993197).

functional_summary: Protein kinase A-anchoring protein that scaffolds the cAMP-dependent protein kinase holoenzyme (19684019). Mutations are associated with PCD, with CC/RS defects like abnormal axoneme configuration and absence of RS. Required for proper building of RSs and the CC in humans (26073779). Mutations in RSPH3 in Chlamydomonas reinhardtii lead to paralyzed flagella due to loss of the entire radial spoke structure (29475374).

functional_summary: Component of spoke heads. Plays a central role in the assembly of all the three- types of RS. Contributes to the generation of the planar beating of motile cilia by building the distal architecture of radial spokes, regulating the motion pattern of the mouse motile cilia. Mutations lead to most severe phenotype of PCD with central complex defects and near absence of radial spokes (26073779; 25789548) Essential for the triplet radial spoke head assembly of the mouse motile cilia (32203505).

description: radial spoke head 6 homolog A [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:14241]
functional_summary: RSPH6A is required for sperm flagellar assembly and male fertility in mice. Interacts with RSPH1, RSPH4A, RSPH9 and RSPH10B, where nteraction of RSPH6A and RSPH9 is important to incorporate RSPH9 into the flagella. Absence of RSPH6A leads to immotile spermatozoa in mice (30185526). Expressed exclusively in testicular germ cells during meiosis. Rsph6a is phosphorylated by PKA during sperm capacitation (30239614).

functional_summary: Component of the axonemal radial spoke head. Mutations cause PCD with defects of the central microtubular pair, where altered function of the radial spoke heads causes 9+2 cilia motility to resemble the rotary 9+0 cilia movement (19200523). Essential for ciliary structure and motility in mouse ependymal cilia; deletion causes hydrocephalus. Dysfunction of RSPH9 changes the motion pattern of motile cilia. (32709945). Required for RS head assembly and centrail pair maintenance in mammalian ependimal cilia (30383886).

functional_summary: Regulates early embryonic axial rotation, anteroposterior and dorsoventral patterning in mice and is required for maintenance of a normal ciliary structure (22939636). Required for assembly of full-length centrioles through its STIL- RTTN interaction; it also serves as an upstream effector of CEP295 (28811500). Centrosomal protein possibly involved in centriolar elongation and ciliogenesis. Mutations cause polymicrogyria (30879067) and missense or splicing variants have been found in patients with microcephaly (29967526).

functional_summary: Role in the pre-assembly and targeting of ciliary protein complexes. Ruvbl1 may be a major organiser of dynein arm complex assembly (29959317). Essential for cilia motility in both zebrafish and mouse, cooperating with Ruvbl2 through the assembly of ciliary ODAs and IDAs; requires Ruvbl2 for stability. Essential for the stabilization of axonemal dynein intermediate chain 1 (DNAI1) and DNAI2 in mouse,and facilitates dynein arm assembly in cytosolic foci enriched with R2TP-like complexes (29113992). Depletion of HsRuvBL1 in RPE1 cells leads to the loss of primary cilia (28574207).

functional_summary: Essential for cilia motility in both zebrafish and mouse, through the assembly of ciliary ODAs and IDAs and cooperating with Ruvbl1. Interacts with Hsp90 to regulate the stability of both DNAI1 and DNAI2. Requires Ruvbl1 for stability (29113992). Involved in epigenetic and transcriptional regulation of cilia motility genes; interacts with LRRC6 in a complex involved in dynein arm formation, essential for cilia motility in zebrafish. Candidate gene for PCD (23858445).

functional_summary: Zinc-finger transcription factor that mediates transcriptional repression via its interaction with the nucleosome- remodeling deacetylase (NuRD) complex. Truncated SALL1 interacts with or sequester factors related to cilia function, including the negative regulators of ciliogenesis CCP110 and CEP97. SALL1 mutations can disrupt cilia formation and function (29395072). Truncated SALL1 increases the ubiquitin proteasome- mediated degradation of LUZP1, contributing to Townes-Brocks Syndrome (32553112).

functional_summary: Required for daughter centriole formation and primary cilia assembly in mammalian cells. Recruited to centrioles by STIL (22349705). Interacts with SAS-5 and both are mutually dependent for their centriolar distribution (15665853). Cooperates with PLK4 and STIL to initiate centriole duplication (27911707). Depletion has been shown to reduce the microtubule numbers in Chlamydomonas and Drosophila centrioles, suggesting that SASS6 has a direct role in the regulation of centriolar microtubule formation (26422590).

functional_summary: FAM154A. A microtubule- stabilizing protein specific to cilia and related structures. Regulates cilium axonemal length and promotes microtubule assembly in Hela , RPE1 cells and Trypanosome Brucei (33200789). It binds specifically to centriole and cilium microtubules and is responsible for their targeting and stabilisation. SAXO1 is also reported to be present across the length of human sperm flagellum where it colocalizes with -tubulin, where it could play a role in its biogenesis, stability and length (25673876)

description: S-phase cyclin A associated protein in the ER [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:13081]
functional_summary: Varians have been associated with intellectual disability and autosomal recessive RP. Mutations affect cilia length, suggesting a rol for SCAPER in restricting cilia elongation or enhancing cilia resorption (30723319). Although it is ubiquitously expressed in human tissues, deleterious mutations appear to affect only retina and brain. In the retina, SCAPER appears to be important for photoreceptor function and/or maintenance rather than for development (28794130).

description: sodium channel and clathrin linker 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:26406]
functional_summary: Recruited to centrioles via CEP83. Subsequently, it recruits FBF1 and CEP164. Depletion of SCLT1 in RPE1 cells disruptes CEP164 localisation and blockes cilia formation (23348840). Variants have been identified in patients with a severe ciliopathy phenotype. Candidate gene of autosomal recessive Oroacioigital (OFD) syndrome (24285566). Recruits LRRC45 to the distal appendages of mother centriole (30131441).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; anatomical structure maturation; developmental maturation; cell maturation; centriole; channel regulator activity; transporter regulator activity; ion channel regulator activity

description: SHH signaling and ciliogenesis regulator SDCCAG8 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:10671]
functional_summary: Mutations cause nephronophthisis type 10. Interacts with ODF1 and FAM161A (20835237, 24722439) and FA161A; plays a role in intraciliary trafficking and is essential for the survival and maintenance of both rods and cones (24722439). Mutations have also been reported in patients with Bardet-Biedl syndrome (22190896). Required for the formation of outer segments (22825473).

functional_summary: SUMO specific peptidase 3 (SENP3). Dominant form of de-sumoylation enzymes in human retina (30621560)
functional_category: Unknown

functional_summary: Component of a diffusion barrier at the ciliary base, essential for retaining receptor-signaling pathways in the primary cilium, and is required for cilium-dependent Shh signal transduction. Depletion inhibits ciliogenesis (20558667). Ciliary localisation of SEPT2, suggest that it is involved in organization of the axonemal microtubular structure, controling ciliogenesis and ciliary length (24317785). Forms a complex with SEPT7 and SEPT9 to positively control ciliogenesis and the length of cilia (23572511).

functional_summary: Regulates cell cycle progression at mitosis, replication and G1/S transition. SIRT2 acts as a sensor that links growth factor-dependent signal transduction and primary cilia formation by regulating the cell cycle under nutrient- present conditions. Suppression leads to a cell cycle arrest and promotes formation of primary cilia, by inhibiting mTOR signaling mainly via mTORC1 (32213867). Functions as a tubulin deacetylase. Regulates ciliogenesis and centrosome amplification. Inhibition of SIRT2 induces hyperacetylation of -tubulin and blocks cilia dissaembly. SIRT2 could also be responsible for aberrant centrosome amplification and polyploidy in polycystic kidney disease (24203696).

Smo traslocation to the cilium results in Glis activation (28344083). Hh signalling depends upon a Smo ciliary localization (16136078). Defect in Smo localisation results from defective retrograde transport (16229832). functional_summary: SNX17 functions in early stages of ciliogenesis. Regulates the homeostasis of centriolar satellite proteins including PCM1, CEP131, and OFD1 during serum starvation induced ciliogenesis. Recruits USP9X to antagonise MIB1-induced degradation of PCM1, maintaining the integrity of centriolar satellites. SNX17 deficiency leads degradation of USP9X and PCM1, and disrupts ciliogenesis upon serum starvation (31671755).

functional_summary: Regulatory role in a PKA- independent AKAP complex in both germinal cells and somatic ciliated epithelia. It may also play a role in cell motility (19604394, 15034007). Binds the RII binding domain of AKAP3 along the length of the flagella (15257753).

functional_summary: Orthologue of Chlamydomonas reinhardtii PF20, known to be essential to the structure and function of the motile axoneme. Encodes two proteins, SPAG16L and SPAG16S. SPAG16L is essential for sperm flagellar motility. Interacts with SPAG6, which in turn interacts with SPAG17. Mutation results in instability of interacting proteins in the central pair of the sperm axoneme. (16382026, 17699735). SPAG16S, identified only in male germ cells, plays a role in the gene expression machinery of male germ cells required for spermatogenesis, and it also modulates Spag16L mRNA expression (21655194). Transcription of SPAG16 is regulated through S-SOX5 binding to the promoter (28137312).

functional_summary: Orthologue of Chlamydomonas PF16. Axoneme central apparatus protein, essential for sperm flagellar motility and motility of ependymal cilia, as well as maintenance of the structural integrity of the sperm flagella by serving as a scaffold protein (12167721). Role in ciliogenesis, axoneme orientation, and cell polarity. Spag6-deficient epithelial cells in the brain and trachea lose rotational polarity and Spag6-eficient mice suffer hydrocephalus and are sterile because of sperm motility defects (25333478). Mutated in PCD with male infertility with severe asthenoteratospermia (32124190)

functional_summary: Expressed in spermatocytes and in the mature retina. Mutations have been associated with Leber Congenital Amaurosis and Retinitis Pigmentosa (19268277). Component of a protein complex which interacts with CETN2 and CETN3 to stabilise the photoreceptor distal connecting cilium and proximal OS axoneme (30647131). Interacts with photoreceptor-specific ciliary proteins RPGR and RPGRIP1 to maintain distal connecting cilium (DCC) structure; it also regulares protein localization into the DCC (29899041).

functional_summary: Also known as CLAMP. Regulator of PCP signaling, via localisation of asymmetric PCP components and regulates asymmetric microtubule accumulation. Required for proper PCP- dependent establishment of cilia polarity (29514918). Microtubule- bundling protein, and central pair MT regulator highly expressed in 9 + 2 mammalian cilia. Essential for the assembly and functions of central pair MTs, central pair apparatus, and for ciliary retentions of other central pair proteins such as Spag6 and Hydin (30535028).
