functional_summary: Essential for correct sperm tail development and male fertility. Interacts with intraflagellar transport protein IFT20. Mutation in SPEF2 was identified as a cause for immotile short tail sperm in pigs (19889948). Required for ciliary motility and spermatogenesis. In mouse, loss of SPEF2 function results in PCD with severe spermatogenic defects (21715716). Functional defects also lead to PCD due to a defect of the central pair complex. Interacts with HYDIN, which regulates assembly of SPEF2 to the ciliary axoneme, as it cannot be detected in the axonemes of HYDIN-mutant cells (31545650). Required for the flagellar assembly of central pair complex and peri- axonemal structure in humans (31942643).

functional_summary: Ciliary GPCR. Localized to the plasma membrane of neuronal cilia (10199624, 23392690). Ciliary trafficking of SSTR3 into neural cilia is promoted by TULP3. Overexpression induces premature growth of primary cilia and increases expression levels of Kif3A, IFT88 and cytoplasmatic dynein (23392690). Possible influence on cell survival and/or apoptotic processes, as well as cell cycle (18992731).

description: SSX family member 2 interacting protein [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:16509]
functional_summary: Centriolar satellite and microtubule anchoring protein. Interacts with PCM-1. Essential for the assembly of primary cilia and the recruitment of Cep290 to both satellites and the basal body; it also promotes the ciliary entry of the entire BBSome. Knockdown limits targeting of somatostatin receptor 3, and significantly reduces axoneme length. Possible novel cooperator of Rab8 (24356449). Binds the microtubule-nucleator gamma- tubulin complex. Knockdown of its orthologue in zebrafish, results in ciliary defects and disturbs left-right asymmetry. Microtubule anchoring role to the basal body is required for primary cilia formation (24397932).

functional_summary: Downregulated in diseases associated with ciliopathies, including BBS, PKD and PHP. Regulates multiciliogenesis and differenciation of ciliated cells by phosphorylating MARK3 which supresses ERK1/2 (31636950). Required for CCL2 regulation within cilia, via interactions with NPHP1, ANKS3 and NEK7 (29925518). Bending of cilium activates Lkb1 pathway, which inhibits mTORC1 activity and regulation cell size (20972424). Duct-specific deletion causes duct dilations and shorter cilia with swollen tips, indicative of perturbed intraciliary transport (28159992).

functional_summary: Also knwown as FU. Participates in Hh signaling, 9+2 cilia biogenesis and function, as well as assembly or maintenance of the central pair apparatus. Interacts with Kif27 (19305393), Spag16 and Pcdp1 (23907739). Required for cilia orientation and the integrity of the whole radial spokes head. Essential for recruiting radial spokes head proteins to the axoneme. Mutations are associated with a novel PCD variant (28543983). Stk36 null show craniofacial abnormalities and defects in organs where hedgehog signaling is required (21746835).

functional_summary: Phosphorylates Rabin8 which is crucial role in ciliogenesis. Regulates the process of vesicular trafficking and tethering to the pericentrosome, promoting local activation of Rab8 and ciliary membrane formation. Defects in NDR2-mediated Rabin8 phosphorylation impair preciliary membrane assembly and ciliogenesis, leading to accumulation of Rabin8-/Rab11-containing vesicles at the pericentrosome. Knockdown in RPE1 cells suporesses ciliogenesis (23435566, 28122914). Mutated in canine early retinal degeneration, suggesting a role in photoreceptor cell function (20887780).

description: STIP1 homology and U-box containing protein 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:11427]
functional_summary: Also known as CHIP. E3 ub- ligase. Ubiquitylates and degrades NEK10. Novel regulator of protein turnover at ciliary sites, it couples GPCR signaling to cilia dynamics. Downregulation of CHIP prevents cilia resorption whilst increased expression of CHIP is linked to reduced NEK10 levels and ciliogenesis; role in control of cilium stability. Mutations have been reported in patients with autosomal recessive spinocerebellar ataxia-16 SCAR16 (29581457 ).

description: spectrin repeat containing nuclear envelope protein 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:17089]
functional_summary: Also known as Nesprin1. Integral components of ciliary rootlets of multiciliated cells. Interacts with rootletin (28625779). Essential for the relocalisation of centrosome proteins and components of microtubule motor complexes to the nuclear envelope, and interacts with PCM-1 (27802164). Mutations are associated with cerebellar and non-cerebellar pathologies of unknown molecular pathogenesis (29630990). Mediates centrosome migration and determinationof centrosome/basal body positioning during early cell polarization, an essential step for ciliogenesis (19596800).

description: spectrin repeat containing nuclear envelope protein 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:17084]
functional_summary: Also known as Nespirin2. Colocalises with meckelin at filopodia prior to the establishment of cell polarity and ciliogenesis. Mediates centrosome migration and determinationof centrosome/basal body positioning during early cell polarization, an essential step for ciliogenesis. It may form a linking network between the centrosome and the actin cytoskeleton (19596800). Role in nuclear migration and positioning during retinal development. Interaction partner of Pcnt in photoreceptors. Pcntyne-2 complex is important for ciliogenesis and outer segment formation during retinal development and for the attachment of the centrosome to the nucleus in cycling cells (30054381).

functional_summary: Mutations have been found in patients with a severe ciliopathy phenotype, including autosomal recessive OFD (24285566, 32573025). Interacts with Dzip1l to regulate neural tube patterning and ciliogenesis before the docking of ciliary vesicle to the basal body (29487109). Ciliary gene implicated in SHH signaling, controls ciliary morphology and Gli2 localisation within the cilium. Required for proper association between the ciliary membrane and axoneme and axonemal shape (20159594).

functional_summary: Required for centrosome and Golgi apparatus perinuclear positioning. Depletion reduces primary cilia assembly efficiency/ability and affectes cell shape and migration. TBCCD1-silenced cells showed disorganised Golgi apparatus (20168327). Candidate for primary cause of centrosome amplification due to gain of function (32681070).

functional_summary: Negative regulator of ciliogenesis. Polyubiquitinated at the mother centriole by CRL3-KCTD17. Depletion induces aberrant ciliogenesis, whereas overexpression blocks ciliogenesis (25270598). Interacts with Odf2 and ninein. Controls Aurora A (AurA) activation at the centrioles in G1 phase. TrichopleinurA pathway is required for cell cycle progression through the suppression of primary cilia assembly (22529102). TCHP is deubiquitinated and stabilized by USP8, critical to restrict ciliogenesis in dividing cells (29472535).

functional_summary: Form a complex with Tctn3, Mks1, Tmem216, Tmem67, Cep290, Cc2d2a, B9d1 and Tctn1 to regulate ciliogenesis and ciliary membrane composition (21725307). Mutations disrupts ciliogenesis, Hh signaling (28800946) and neural tube patterning (29725084). Regulator of Shh pathway. Role in selective trafficking of ciliary proteins to cilia, required for ciliogenesis (29725084). Indispensible for ciliogenesis in the neural tube (21565611). Mutations have also been identified as cause of Meckelruber syndrome (32655147).

functional_summary: Form a complex with Tctn2, Mks1, Tmem216, Tmem67, Cep290, Cc2d2a, B9d1 and Tctn1 to regulate ciliogenesis and ciliary membrane composition (21725307). Mutations disrupts ciliogenesis and Hh signaling (28800946) and are also the causes of Joubert syndrome (30286481). Regulator of Shh pathway. Role in selective trafficking of ciliary proteins to cilia, required for ciliogenesis (29725084). Role for GLI3 processing and function. Mutations cause severe orofaciodigital syndrome, Mohr-Majewski syndrome (22883145).

functional_summary: Positive regulator of cilium length. Its expression is controlled by the transcription factor FOXJ1. In zebrafish, it is required for fully efficient motility of cilia in various organs, and for ciliogenesis or maintenance of motile cilia in the KV. Mutations of which may cause ciliary dyskinesia (29121203).

Candidate gene for PCD (15340058).

functional_summary: Role in the actin dynamics and actin cytoskeleton remodelling, via inactivation of the actin-severing protein CFL. Supresses ciliogenesis by upregulating the expression of YAP/TAZ target genes, as well as modulating directional trafficking of ciliary vesicles to the ciliary base. TESK1 overexpression interferes with serum starvation-mediated ciliogenesis (25849865).

functional_summary: Critical regulator of cilia formation and morphology (26518474). Controls ciliary proteincomposition. Functions redundantly with NPHP4 to regulate cilium integrity, transition zone docking and assembly of membrane to microtubule Y- link connectors. Recruits ciliopathy proteins MKS1, TMEM231 and TMEM237. Mutated in OFD and JBTS patients (26595381). In mice, mutations decrease cilia number and disrupt Hh signaling. Essential for craniofacial development (28954202). Acts synergistically with Gli2 as a positive mediator of Shh and ciliogenesis (22698544). Loss of Tmem107 results in disruption in early L- R patterning events at the node (31887266).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; protein localization to cilium; non-motile cilium assembly; left/right pattern formation; determination of left/right symmetry; specification of symmetry; determination of bilateral symmetry; regionalization; pattern specification process; neural tube development; neural tube patterning; embryonic digit morphogenesis; appendage development; limb development; appendage morphogenesis; limb morphogenesis; embryonic limb morphogenesis; embryonic appendage morphogenesis; bone development; cranial skeletal system development; roof of mouth development; skeletal system morphogenesis; bone morphogenesis; craniofacial suture morphogenesis; ciliary transition zone; MKS complex

functional_summary: Mutations cause JBTS. Required for ciliogenesis. Mutations lead to shorter cilia, and knockdown cells show defects of ciliogenesis. It might mark vesicles en route to the base of cilium, which is known to be crucial for ciliary assembly (22282472).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly

functional_summary: CEP-290-dependent transition zone protein that facilitates cilium formation, being necessary for ciliogenesis; mutated in OFD6 (26982032).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; non-motile cilium assembly; smoothened signaling pathway; ciliary transition zone; ciliary membrane; cell projection membrane; MKS complex

functional_summary: Required for ciliogenesis. It might mark vesicles en route to the base of cilium, which is known to be crucial for ciliary assembly. Mutations cause JBTS (22282472). Mutated in OFD6 (26982032) and in Meckel syndrome MKS (21493627). Mutations or knockdown result in impaired ciliogenesis and centrosome docking. Modulates hyper- responsiveness of signaling pathways mediated by Dvl and RhoA, suggesting they might be part of a complex to mediate cellular polarization and centrosomal apical docking (20512146).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; non-motile cilium assembly; ciliary transition zone; MKS complex

functional_summary: Interacts with several JBTS proteins as part of the B9 complex, involved in the formation of the diffusion barrier between the cilia and plasma membrane, maintaining the integrity of the cilia. Knockdown results in a reduction of cilia formation, and perturbs localisation of components of the B9 complex at the transition zone and ciliary localisation of signalling receptors. Mutations have been associated with JBTS (23012439). Mutated in MKS (23349226). Critical for organizing the MKS complex and controlling ciliary composition. Mutated in OFD3. In mice, mutations disrupt the localisation of proteins Arl13b and Inpp5e to cilia (25869670).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; smoothened signaling pathway; eye development; camera-type eye development; visual system development; sensory system development; columnar/cuboidal epithelial cell differentiation; in utero embryonic development; embryonic digit morphogenesis; appendage development; limb development; appendage morphogenesis; limb morphogenesis; embryonic limb morphogenesis; embryonic appendage morphogenesis; neuroepithelial cell differentiation; ciliary transition zone; ciliary membrane; cell projection membrane; MKS complex

functional_summary: Also known as JBTS-14 . Interacts functionally with NPHP4, MKS2, MKSR1, MKSR2, and MKS5 at the transition zone. Its interaction with NPHP4 promotes basal body-TZ attachment to the membrane and cilium formation. Loss of TMEM237 results in defective ciliogenesis and deregulation of Wnt signaling. Mutated in Joubert syndrome related disorders (22152675).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; Wnt signaling pathway; regulation of Wnt signaling pathway; non-motile cilium; ciliary transition zone; 9+0 non-motile cilium; photoreceptor cell cilium; photoreceptor connecting cilium; photoreceptor outer segment

functional_summary: Also known as Meckelin or MKS3. Component of the MKS-JBTS module at the transition zone. Essential for phosphorylation of the non- canonical Wnt receptor ROR2. Negative regulator of Shh signalling. Required for centriolar migration to the apical membrane during cell polarisation, regulation of actin cytoskeleton remodelling and RhoA activity (26035863). Required for the elongation and maintenance of the outer segments in retina. It may play a role in photoreceptor intraciliary transport (22247471). Mutations are a major cause of MKS, JBTS and NPHP (23393159). MKS function is required for ciliary structure and function; plays a role in regulating cilia length and number through modulating centrosome duplication (19515853). In complex with other TZ proteins, it contributes to an early ciliogenic event and establish basal body/TZ membrane attachments (21422230).
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; regulation of microtubule-based process; microtubule organizing center organization; centrosome cycle; centrosome duplication; Wnt signaling pathway; negative regulation of organelle organization; non-canonical Wnt signaling pathway; regulation of centrosome cycle; regulation of centrosome duplication; negative regulation of cytoskeleton organization; negative regulation of cell cycle; negative regulation of cell cycle process; negative regulation of centrosome duplication; negative regulation of centrosome cycle; ciliary transition zone; ciliary membrane; cell projection membrane; MKS complex; unfolded protein binding

functional_summary: Also known as Importin beta 2. Regulated RP2 trafficking into the ciliary compartment (21285245). Interacts with KIF17; this interaction is required for the ciliary entry of KIF17 (20526328). TNPO1 for a complex with Rab8 and CTSs (ciliary target signals) to mediate selective entry and retention of cargos within cilia (27633000).

description: TOG array regulator of axonemal microtubules 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:19959]
functional_summary: Mutated in JBTS37. TOGARAM1 localized along the ciliary axoneme in hTERT-RPE1 cells and was associated with longer cilia when knocked down. Binds directly to ARMC9, forming a protein module that localizes to microtubule-like structures at the centriole and proximal portion of the cilium. The interaction with ARMC9 mapped to the N-terminal protein of TOGARAM1 (32453716; 32747439).

functional_summary: Component of the photoreceptor sensory cilium. Potential role in the regulation of primary cilia-dependent photoreceptor development and function. Knockdown leads to increased cell death in the retina of zebrafish (21159800). Mutations have been associated with autosomal dominant retinitis pigmentosa (17924349, 18509552).

functional_summary: Also called P73. Might be critical for the initiation of cilia assembly by indirectly promoting the multiplication of centrosomes (25201258). Transcription factor critical to multiciliogenesis. Required for multiciliated cells differentiation, function and for the direct regulation of transcriptional modulators of multiciliogenesis, including Foxj1, Rfx2 and Rfx3 (31028178, 27257214, 26947080). Required for basal body docking, axonemal extension and motility (27257214).

functional_summary: Also known as IFT54. Evolucionairly conserved role in ciliogenesis, interacts with with tubulin and actin. Mutations lead to altered cilia mediated hedgehog signaling (21945076). Plays a critical role in IFT, as well as building and maintaining functional cilia (18369462). IFT-B subunit which regulates ciliary composition. Inactivation is embryonic lethal and causes characteristic ciliopathy phenotypes (26487268). Interacts with and stabilises IFT20 and Rabaptin5, which in turn interacts with Rab8, suggesting a potential role for IFT in regulating the assembly of ciliary membranes. It may also participate in tubulin transport for ciliogenesis. Loss of IFT54 impairs cilia assembly as well as cytoplasmic MT dynamics (28417161). Interacts with both kinesinI and IFT dynein and regulates anterograde IFT (33368450).

Required for FOXJ1 expression. Knockdown of TRRAP decreased the number of ciliated cells, and knockout mice are not viable (29588376).

Required for activation of canonical TGF- signaling. Regulates Smoothened (SMO)- dependent HH signaling in cilia (29396625). Role in maintaining cell polarity (19321600).

Associates with the GSK3/axin complex to inhibit canonical Wnt-signalling (19321600). Required for the normal trafficking of PC-1 from the Golgi to the membrane (20169078).

functional_summary: Role in spermatogenesis. Possible role in the structure of primary cilium, as it was found to colocalise with gamma- tubulin in COS-1 cells (16643851).
functional_category: motile cilium; centriole

functional_summary: Regulator of the initiation of ciliogenesis in vivo. Ttbk2 mutants lack cilia. Promotes the removal of CP110 from the mother centriole, the recruitment and retention of IFT proteins at the distal end of basal body, to initiate the assembly of the ciliary axoneme (23141541). Mutations have been associated with dominant human neurodegenerative disorder Spinocerebellar Ataxia type 11 (18037885). Interacts in a complex with CP164, which is required for its ciliary localisation. Promotes assembly of distal appendages at both centrioles and Cep83 localisation (24982133). Phosphorylates Cep164, Cep97 and inhibits the interaction between Cep164 and Dvl3 (25297623). Phosphorylated CEP83, which is required for ciliary vesicle docking and CP110 removal (31455668). Remains at the transition zone of the cilium following ciliogenesis, to regulate cilium stability (30532139).

Knockdown induces microtubule anchoring defects (24876116). Mutated in nephronophthisis, syndromic Jeune Asphyxiating Thoracic Dystrophy (21258341), Focal Segmental glomerulosclerosis (24876116) and Joubert Syndrome (29615573).

functional_summary: Mutated in OFD. TTC23 localizes to the shaft of the cilia in controls but is restricted mainly to the base of the cilia in patient fibroblasts. Patient fibroblasts show normal ciliogenesis but increased length of cilia compared with control (32055034). Affinity purification and mass spectrometry show TTC23 to strongly associate with IQCE and EFCAB7, components of the Ellisan Creveld (EvC) zone (29459677)
functional_category: smoothened signaling pathway; regulation of smoothened signaling pathway; positive regulation of smoothened signaling pathway

functional_summary: Also known as NYD-SP14. Strongly expressed in tissues with motile cilia and flagella. Functions in cilia and flagella, most likely as an inner-arm dynein subunit. Chlamydomonas homologue encodes 44kDa subunit of axonemal dynein (17981992). Involved in functional interaction with the IFT machinery, participating in anterograde IFT. Mutations have been associated with multiple morphological abnormalities of the flagella (31735294).
functional_category: cilium organization; microtubule-based movement; cilium movement; motile cilium; 9+2 motile cilium; sperm flagellum

functional_summary: Mutated in MKS. TTC6 localizes to the centrosome and ciliary shaft in controls but only to the centrosome in patient fibroblasts (32055034)
functional_category: Unknown

functional_summary: Also known as BBS8. Component of the BBSome complex, interacts with PCM1. Mutations leads to Bardet-Biedl syndrome with randomization of left-right body axis symmetry (14520415). Role in intraciliary/flagellar transport, coordinating the velocity of the kinesin molecular motors during anterograde transport. Interacts with Vangl2 to establish and maintain of vertebrate left-right asymmetry. It may also be responsible for maintaining normal cilium length in the KV but not cilia number (20643117). Required for the development, maintenance and survival of photoreceptors and outer segments in both rods and cones (29126234). Knockdown reduces ciliary length and increases levels of HDAC6 (30446775).

functional_summary: Recruited by ARL13B and FIP5 (30120249). Higher activity initiating glutamate chains than elongating them. Required for RPGRORF15 function as it seems to be highly selective (27162334). Essential for the correct function of sperm flagella. It might also be responsible for the tubulin polyglutamination in the microtubule triplets of the centrioles, increasing the centriole stability. Mutations have been identified as cause of recessive retinal dystrophy (24791901), and reduced sperm motility and infertility in humans (28173158).

functional_summary: It may function in initiating glygylation modification by attaching the first glycine to tubulin. Interacts with TTLL10 and is required for TTLL10 efficient tubulin glycylation function (19427864). Redundant function with TTLL3, as both are unique monoglycylating enzymes in mammals. Required for stability and maintenance of motile ependymal cilia. Absence of TTL3 leads to absence of glycylation on axonemes, destabilising motile ependymal cilia and resulting in ciliary disassembly (23897886, 25180231).

functional_summary: Role in intracellular transport, cell differentiation, signaling, and motility (33187986). Associates with IFT-A in a complex to regulate trafficking and localisation of G protein-coupled receptors into cilia. Negative regulator of Hedgehog signaling (20889716). Adapter for ciliary trafficking of membrane cargo; regulates PC1/2 complex trafficking (28154160). Required for proper Shh-dependent limb patterning, as it inhibits Gli2 activity (19286674). Essential for trafficking of Arl13b and INPP5E into cilia. Loss of function causes ciliopathy-associated polycystic kidney disease, downregulates the formation of cilia and their length (30799240, 30583862).

functional_summary: Deubiquitinating enzyme localised to centrosome, involved in context-dependent ciliogenesis. Regulates level of ubiquitination of NPHP5 to control ciliogenesis. In the G0/G1/S phase, USP9X is recruited to the centrosome by NPHP5, and later protects NPHP5 from ubiquitination, promoting cilia assembly. In the G2/M phase, USP9X dissociates from the centrosome allowing BBS11 to K63 ubiquitinate NPHP5, triggering loss of cilia. Works with two E3 ubiquitin ligases BBS11/TRIM32 and MARCHF7 (28498859). Binds and stabilises PCM1 to prevent its degradation and regulate centriolar satellite integrity. Regulates centrosome duplication (30584065). During Serum- Starvation-Induced Ciliogenesis, it is recruited by SNX17 to antagonize MIB1- Mediated Ubiquitination and Degradation of PCM1 (31671755).

description: WD repeat containing planar cell polarity effector [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:28027]
functional_summary: MIM: 613580. Also known as C2ORF86, BBS15 or FRITZ. Regulates planar cell polarity through the modulation of the actin cytoskeleton. Required for recruitment of proteins essential for ciliogenesis to the transition zone, including Sept2, Nphp1, and Mks1, and facilitates the assembly of multiprotein complexes. Mutations have been associated with Bardet-Biedl and and Meckel-Gruber syndromes (24302887; 32055034). Knockdown leads to fewer and shorter cilia and decreses the expression of Septin7 in human nasal epithelium, indication that Septin7 could be a target of WDPCP (28001338). Regulates cilia function and beating through activation of MAPK/ERK pathway in the mitochondria of sinonasal epithelial cells (33598458).

functional_summary: Truncating, frameshift or missense mutations cause primary autosomal recessive microcephaly type 2 (OMIM:613583). A WDR62- CEP170-KIF2A pathway promotes cilium disassembly in neural progenitors (31197141). WDR62 ablation leads to retarded cilium disassembly, long cilium, and delayed cell cycle progression leading to decreased proliferation and premature differentiation of neural progenitor cells (31197141). Localises to mitotic spindle poles with paralog MAPKBP1 (28089251). Localises to the basal body. MIssense mutants localise to basal body but fail to recruit CPAP and IFT88 (31816041)

functional_summary: POC16 in Chlamydomonas, localises to the central core region of the centriole in Chlamydomonas, which correlates with the region of tubulin glutamylation in humans. Recruited after the cartwheel protein CrSAS-6 and before tubulin glutamylation. Localizes to mother and daughter centrioles in human RPE1 cells and is required for ciliogenesis (28781053)
functional_category: cilium organization; cilium assembly; centriole

functional_summary: DFNB31/whirlin. PDZ scaffold protein. Mutated in autosomal recessive non-syndromic deafness type 31 (12833159) and Usher syndrome type 2D (17171570) in humans (OMIM 607928). Only the whirlin long isoform (with an additional N-terminal PDZ domain) is expressed in the retina, the retina is affected if this extra PDZ domain is mutated (20502675). Localises to the tiip of the ssterocilium of the cochlear hair cell (15590698). Interacts directly with USH2A and VLGR1 in the connecting cilium of photoreceptor cells (16434480). Colocalizes with MPP1 in the retina at the outer limiting membrane, at the outer synaptic layer and at the basal bodies and the ciliary axoneme of the connecting cilium of the photoreceptors (17584769). Interacts with L-type calcium channel subunit Ca(v)1.3 (alpha(1D) at synpase in retina (19959638). Interacts with RPGR(ORF15) in the photoreceptors (22323458)

functional_summary: Transcription factor. Directs the formation and function of node cilia to control cardiac situs in mice. Component of the gene regulatory network that drives ciliation of node cells during gastrulation in mice. 24585447 Contributes to establishment of LR asymmetry by regulating left-sided nodal expression in mice 29992973. Involved in dorsal neural tube formation in zebrafish and mice, downregulated in zebrafish Rfx4 mutants (29243319). Heterozygous frameshift mutations cause holoprosenchephaly in humans (OMIM: 603073).

functional_summary: Recessive biallelic mutations in ZMYND10 cause a form of PCD in which patients lack inner dynein arms and outer dynein arms and lack axonemal protein components DNAH5 and DNALI1 from respiratory cilia (CILD22, OMIM:63395) (23891469). Interacts with LRCC6, also a cause of PCD (CILD19, OMIM:614930). LRRC6 mutations abrogate the interaction between the LRRC6 CS domain and the ZMYND10 C-terminal domain (23891469). Colocalizes with SAS6 and PCM at the centriole in rat trachea (23891469). Stabilizes intermediate chain proteins in the cytoplasmic pre-assembly of dynein arms (29601588). Functions in a chaperone relay during axonemal dynein assembly (29916806)

description: BicC family RNA binding protein 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:19351]
functional_summary: Localization of BICC1 in cilia is controversial. Targeted inactivation of BicC randomizes left-right (LR) asymmetry by disrupting the planar alignment of motile cilia required for cilia-driven fluid flow. Depending on its SAM domain, BicC can uncouple Dvl2 signaling from the canonical Wnt pathway. The SAM domain concentrates BicC in cytoplasmic structures harboring RNA-processing bodies (P-bodies) and Dvl2. BicC links the orientation of cilia with PCP, possibly by regulating RNA silencing in P-bodies (19666828).

functional_summary: Mice with a null mutation in Efcab1, which encodes calaxin, display typical phenotypes of primary ciliary dyskinesia, including hydrocephalus, situs inversus, and abnormal motility of trachea cilia and sperm flagella. The 9 + 2 axonemal structures of epithelial multicilia and sperm flagella are normal, but the formation of 9 + 0 nodal cilia is significantly disrupted. Knockout of calaxin in zebrafish also causes situs inversus due to the irregular ciliary beating of Kupffer vesicle cilia, although the 9 + 2 axonemal structure appears to remain normal(31240264).; CLXN is an outer dynein arm-docking complexssociated component. CLXN functions as an ODA-DC subunit in human respiratory cilia especially involved in the docking of distal type 2 ODAs(36727596).

functional_summary: DAAM1 is present within the the actin-rich base of multiciliated epidermal cells of the X. laevis skin where it regulates the actin network that stabilizes cilia. Loss of Daam1 in motile cilia results in their loss of polarity(26644512). Loss of the PCP component Daam1 negatively regulates ciliogenesis in MDCKII and IMCD3 cells. Daam1 knockdown within these mammalian kidney epithelial cells result in the formation of fewer cilia. Ciliogenesis in MDCKII cells depends on the formin activity of Daam1. In MDCKII and IMCD3 cells Daam1 localizes to vesicles that carry ciliary components(31469868).

functional_summary: Interestingly, alteration in HIF expression by hypoxia or pharmacological mimics has also been shown to influence primary cilia length [21241248 , 22084569] and activate the hedgehog pathway [35]. Prolyl hydroxylase inhibition results in ciliary elongation and a more pronounced recruitment of HIF-2 to the ciliary base and sequestration to the ciliary axonome. Elongation drives ciliary sequestration leading to negative regulation of HIF-2 expression and activity.  HIFs have relationship with the primary cilium in inflammation(18774959).

description: EGFR pathway substrate 8, signaling adaptor [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:3420]
functional_summary: Epidermal growth factor receptor pathway substrate 8 (Eps8, 8404850) is an evolutionarily conserved signal transducer endowed with multiple functions in the control of actin dynamics and in the integration of these events with other receptor-activated signaling functions. Depending on its association with other signal transducers, Eps8 can regulate the activation of the Rac GTPase, a master regulator of actin remodeling (10499589 , 11524436). Eps8 knockout mice are deaf and the normal physiological development of IHCs is prevented(21526224).

functional_summary: Ezrin is localised on ciliary basal bodies in multiciliated cells (MCCs) (14996907). Ezrin, ELMO-DOCK1 and its downstream effector Rac1 cooperate and function as a module during the highly coordinated processes of ciliary basal body targeting and docking to the apical membrane. Depletion of any of these components leads to defects in basal body docking and spacing, and ultimately to defects in ciliary function(25516973).

functional_summary: Planar cell polarity (PCP) proteins are known to organize microtubule polarization, which establishes the planar polarity of cells (25124458). functional_summary: Hook2 localized to the centrosome through all phases of the cell cycle, its C-term domain directly binds to centriolin/CEP110, and it was demonstrated to contribute to the establishment and maintenance of centrosomal structure and function (17140400). Hook2 depletion prevents ciliogenesis initiation, and this defect can be overcome by overexpression of murine Hook2 or Rab8a. Hook2 interacts with and regulates the expression of PCM1 that controls Rab8a recruitment to the primary cilium. The existence of a functional complex containing Rab8a and Hook2 in association with PCM1, where Hook2 could play a role as an adaptor in the attachment of post-Golgi vesicles to the mother centriole during the formation of the ciliary sheath(21998199).

functional_summary: Mutations in IMPG2 are associated with retinitis pigmentosa and vitelliform macular dystrophy (20673862). When probed with an antibody raised to its C-terminal intracellular domain, IMPG2 immunoreactivity was mostly found within the ellipsoid and myoid zones of the inner segment in normal photoreceptors. In normal photoreceptors, CEP290 allows entry of outer segment-bound proteins while blocking that of inner segment proteins such as STX3, STXBP1, SNAP25, and IMPG2. In Cep290fl/fl;Cre+ retinas, however, a significant amount of IMPG2 immunoreactivity was detected in outer segments in addition to inner segments (31694913).

functional_summary: KIFC3 is a minus-end-directed kinesin-14, provides microtubule-based centrosome cohesion. KIFC3 forms a homotetramer that pulls the two centrosomes together via a specific microtubule network. At mitotic onset, KIFC3 activity becomes the main driving force of centrosome cohesion to prevent premature spindle formation after linker dissolution as it counteracts the increasing EG5-driven pushing forces (31481795).

functional_summary: MAP9, originally identified as a MT-binding protein stabilizing MT structure during both mitosis and interphase in human cell lines (16049101). MAP9 has a role in the formation and function of primary cilia; specific expression of the C. elegans MAP9 ortholog MAPH-9 in ciliated sensory neurons (27930654; 33798428); map9 depletion induced developmental abnormalities related to cilia-dependent signaling pathways in zebrafish (24553125); and MAP9 localized in the photoreceptor CC region of canine retina (28993665). MAP9 is prominently localized in the basal body of primary cilia and played an important role in maintaining the structure of ciliary microtubule axoneme(37650070).

functional_summary: The melanocortin 4 receptor (MC4R) is a Gs-coupled GPCR that transduces anorexigenic signals in the long-term regulation of energy homeostasis (26814590). Heterozygous mutations in MC4R in humans and deletion of MC4R in mice are the most common monogenic cause of severe obesity , and individuals with homozygous null mutations display severe early-onset obesity (10903341, 9019399). In ciliated cells, MC4R localized to primary cilia (29311635).

functional_summary: Macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) is a structure protein of basal bodies, which forms a ring-like structure at proximal end of centrioles to regulate cilia assembly and elongation through defined ciliary proteins, including CP110, TTBK2, CEP290, and IFT related proteins, The phosphatidylinositol-5-phosphate 4-kinase type 2 alpha (PIP4K2a) is an upstream regulator of MIF, which interacts and phosphorylates MIF at S91 to increase the interaction of MIF with 14-3-3, resulting in MIF nuclear translocation. Nuclear MIF functions to regulate the transcription of ciliary related genes(38052787).

functional_summary: MIM is able to bind to the intracellular mediators of Shh signaling Sufu and Gli and positively regulate the pathway (17497115). MIM is part of a basal body complex required for primary cilia maintenance and Shh signaling, and functions by a mechanism that involves antagonism of CTTN phosphorylation by p60 Src kinase. MIM is required in the dermal papilla for primary cilia formation and hair follicle regeneration (20708589).

description: NUBP iron-sulfur cluster assembly factor 1, cytosolic [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:8041]
functional_summary: Nubp1 and Nubp2 interact with each other, but their individual knockdown, however, has differential effects on centrosome and spindle formation: while Nubp1 silencing qualitatively phenocopies KIFC5A silencing, also resulting in significant centrosome amplification throughout the cell cycle and the formation of multipolar spindles, Nubp2 appears to have a modulatory/accessory role for centriole arithmetics, in concert with KIFC5A and Nubp1 [16638812]. Nubp1 and Nubp2 localize on interphase centrioles in cycling cells and basal bodies in quiescent cells(23807208).

functional_summary: Pa2G4 is essential for proper ciliogenesis and synchronized movement of cilia in multiciliated cells (MCCs) and the gastrocoel roof plate (GRP). Pa2G4 morphant MCCs exhibit defective basal body docking to the surface as a result of compromised Rac1 activity, apical actin network formation, and immature distal appendage generation. Interestingly, the regions that include the RNA-binding domain and the C-terminus of Pa2G4 are necessary for ciliogenesis in both MCCs and GRP cells(39496919).

description: ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 4 (PEL blood group) [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:55]
functional_summary: Also known as leakytail. ATP- binding cassette transporter which transports prostaglandin E2 and other molecules across cellular membranes. Mutations in ABCC4 cause ciliogenesis defects. ABCC4-mediated PGE2 signalling acts through a ciliary G-protein-coupled receptor, EP4, to upregulate cAMP synthesis and increase anterograde IFT, thereby promoting ciliogenesis ( 25173977). Zebrafish abcc4 mutants exhibited loss of connecting cilia and outer segment in photoreceptor cells, leading to mislocalization of opsins in the cell bodies of photoreceptors ( 30685088). Specific missense associated with polydactyly in pigs ( 32228435)

functional_summary: The Abi2 KO mice had small testes, which on histopathology showed testicular degeneration, marked, chronic, bilateral, multifocal vacuolation of the seminiferous tubular epithelium with hypocellularity, sparse spermatids, and very few spermatozoa tubular lumens, suggesting a failure in the maturation of sperm and subsequent immune-mediated degradation of the sperm leading to testicular atrophy. KO of Abi2 shows both eye and male reproductive abnormalities consistent with ciliopathies ( 36456625).

functional_summary: Naringenin exerted its protective effect on ciliary structure and number in part via modulation of the IL-17 signaling pathway. Naringenin prevented CSE-induced cilia damage via mechanisms such as the upregulation of inflammatory factors (e.g., IL-6, IL-8, IL-13), ROS and MDA. IL-17 signaling pathway might be involved in the protective effect of naringenin on airway cilia ( 38359483).

In the bronchiolar epithelium, absence ofApc blocked the differentiation of a subpopulation of cells committed to the ciliogenesis program. In the human pulmonary adenocarcinoma cells, Apc over-expression inhibitedJag1expression and promoted motile ciliogenic gene expression program includingFoxj1, revealing the potential mechanism( 23646120).

functional_summary: Treatment of N1 hypothalamic neuron cells with leptin stimulated cilia assembly via inhibition of the tumor suppressors PTEN and glycogen synthase kinase 3 (GSK3). Induction of short cilia in the hypothalamus of adult mice increased food intake and decreased energy expenditure, leading to a positive energy balance. Mice with short hypothalamic cilia exhibited attenuated anorectic responses to leptin, insulin, and glucose, which indicates that leptin-induced cilia assembly is essential for sensing these satiety signals by hypothalamic neurons.( 24667636) .

Ortholog duboraya (dub), has been reported to be essential for actin organization in the cells lining Kupffer's vesicle, regulates ciliogenesis in a phosphorylation-dependent manner as well as left-right patterning in zebrafish ( 17013396). Phosphorylated by ERK7. Ciliogenesis regulations through CapZIP, requires Dvl binding to both ERK7 and CapZIP ( 25823377).

functional_summary: Transcription factor regulating expression of ciliary assembly (like Dync2li1, Foxj1 and Bbs4) and axonemal dyneins involved in ciliary motility (Dnahc11, Dnahc9 and Dnahc5), by binding directly to the promoters of their genes. Regulates the orthologs of genes involved inhuman PCD. It may also cooperate with FOXJ1 to regulate the expression of cilia genes ( 19671664). Regulates the expression of D2lic in mouse, a gene implicated in intraflagellar transport, a proces required for the assembly and maintenance of cilia. RFX3 is essential for the differentiation of nodal monocilia and for LR patterning ( 15121860). Together with FOXJ1, plays a role in modulating differentiation in multiciliated cells ( 23822649).

functional_summary: Mitochondrial protein expressed specifically in distal convoluted tubule and cortical collecting duct cells. Homozygous frameshift and splice-site mutations cause an autosomal recessive nephronophisis-like nephropathy in humans (OMIM:613553),  20179356. targeted to mitochondria by an amino- terminal mitochondrial signal sequence. Has N-terminal proline cleavage activity. E.coli ortholog can can efficiently cleave CEP290/NPHP6, ALMS1, and LRRC50 N-terminus. Cleavage of N-terminus of LRRC50 is essential for normal gastrulation in zebrafish ( 20179356)
functional_category: renal system process; protein processing

functional_summary: Transcriptional co-activator with TAZ. Knockdown of YAP does not inhibiti ciliogenesis( 25367221) but is sufficient to induce ciliogenesis, whereas YAP/TAZ hyperactivation suppresses serum starvation- mediated ciliogenesis ( 25849865). Cytoplasmic retention of YAP/TAZ correlates with active ciliogenesis either in spatially confined cells or in cells treated with an actin filament destabilizer ( 25849865). Mutations in NEK8/NPHP9 affect YAP nuclear localisation, with different mutations having different effects, leading to major organ developmental defects due to altered ciliogenesis and cell differentiation/proliferation ( 26967905)
